0.title: Deepika, Alia are different people; they have different body language: Bhansali
0.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that actors Deepika Padukone and Alia Bhatt are two different people. "They are different people. They have different approaches, they have different heights....they have different body language," Sanjay said. He added that whatever roles he had chosen for Alia and Deepika were based on "right casting" and not on who could have played it better.

1.title: In pics: Ukraine residents prepare to defend cities after Russian invasion
1.article_body: Ukrainian citizens are taking up arms, making anti-tank obstacles and joining the Ukrainian Territorial Defence Forces to defend their cities amid the Russian invasion. They're preparing Molotov cocktails or petrol bombs by pouring a flammable liquid into a glass bottle, that can be set on fire for defence. They are throwing Molotov cocktails in open spaces for training purposes.

2.title: Operation Ganga proves India's increasing influence in world: PM
2.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine under Operation Ganga proves the increasing influence of India in the world. "At a time when other countries are finding it difficult to rescue its citizens, we managed to get our people out," PM Modi said. He was speaking at an event in Pune's Symbiosis University.

3.title: Fantastic landmark: Sachin on Ashwin overtaking Kapil Dev's 434 Test wickets
3.article_body: Reacting to India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin overtaking Kapil Dev's record of 434 Test wickets and becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Fantastic landmark." He added, "To go past Kapil paaji is an achievement in itself. The way you were going, it was only a matter of time." The 35-year-old has taken 436 Test wickets so far.

4.title: Astronomers discover first-ever black hole that spins on its side
4.article_body: A team of international astronomers discovered the first-ever black hole that spins on its side. In the star system, MAXI J1820+070, the researchers found the black hole's rotation axis tilted by more than 40 degrees with respect to its orbital axis. "This finding challenges current theoretical models of black hole formation," said study author, Svetlana Berdyugina.

5.title: Mumbai JCP Vishwas Patil's autobiography to be released in English
5.article_body: Mumbai Joint Commissioner of Police, Vishwas Nangre Patil's autobiography 'Mann Mein Hai Vishwas', originally written in Marathi, is now being released in English. The translated book, titled 'Head Held High', will be released on March 28. It has its foreword written by former Mumbai Commissioner, Julio Ribeiro and has been endorsed by actor Amitabh Bachchan and cricketer Sachin Tendulkar.

6.title: 23-yr-old killed after being hit by a speeding truck in Pune
6.article_body: A 23-year-old man, identified as Subhan Jafir Shaikh, was killed after getting hit by a speeding truck near Dharmavat Petrol pump in Pisoli, Pune. The accused was overspeeding and rammed into the deceased's two-wheeler, causing him to fall. The truck then ran over him, which killed him instantly, according to the police. Shaikh was a resident of Uttar Pradesh.

7.title: Best friend Hiddleston 1st to know about Spider-Man cameo: Charlie
7.article_body: Actor Charlie Cox, who made a cameo as lawyer Matt Murdock in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', has revealed that his best friend Tom Hiddleston was the first person to know about the cameo. Tom portrays Loki in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Charlie further said that Tom advised him to sneak into the back of a theatre after the film's release.

8.title: Rules must be relaxed for students back from Ukraine: Varun Gandhi
8.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Sunday said that medical students returning from Ukraine should be integrated into Indian institutions by relaxing rules. "The Ukraine dispute has left thousands of students mentally broken. On one side, there are bitter memories of the battlefield and on the other, their future hangs in the balance," Gandhi further said.

9.title: COVID-19 hit me like a tonne of bricks: Pregnant Harry Potter actress from hospital
9.article_body: English actress Jessie Cave, who is pregnant with her fourth child, was rushed to hospital. In an Instagram post from the hospital, the 34-year-old actress asked, "Anyone else had covid in 3rd trimester & had it hit them like a tonne of bricks for weeks?" Jessie is best known to fans for playing Lavender Brown in the Harry Potter franchise.

10.title: Girls made us mighty proud: Uthappa on India's win vs Pak in Women's WC
10.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa took to Twitter to praise India after their 107-run win against Pakistan at 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand. "Girls made us mighty proud. Phenomenal all-round performance to register a thumping win!! What a start to the World Cup campaign!" he wrote. Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "What a massive win by the girls...congratulations...well done."

11.title: Tribes may have controlled Roman emerald mines by 4th century: Study
11.article_body: A study by international archaeologists said nomadic tribes from Egypt's Eastern Desert, Blemmyes, may have controlled region's emerald mines of Roman Empire between fourth and sixth centuries. During the excavations, team found a set of buildings occupied or even built by Blemmyes surrounding the mines. The researchers also documented two ritual sanctuaries preserved at the main temple of Sikait.

12.title: Over 1.5 mn flee Ukraine, Europe's fastest-growing refugee crisis since WW2: UN
12.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Sunday tweeted that more than 1.5 million people have fled Ukraine for neighbouring countries in 10 days, the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. The UNHCR had reported that numbers had crossed the million mark on March 2 at midnight. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

13.title: Sweden & Finland to step up security cooperation amid Ukraine crisis
13.article_body: Sweden and Finland will strengthen their security cooperation amid Russia's military offensive against Ukraine, Finnish PM Sanna Marin and her Swedish counterpart Magdalena Andersson said on Saturday. Marin added that discussions on Finland's possible alliance with NATO will take place in parliament. Notably, Sweden and Finland share close military ties, including conducting joint drills.

14.title: Capricorn sister Deepika was stunning in 'Gehraiyaan': Anusha
14.article_body: VJ Anusha Dandekar on Sunday took to Instagram to praise Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Gehraiyaan' writing that she "really, truly loved it". Anusha further wrote in the caption, "Just like I love this beautiful Capricorn sister of mine. Deepika you are stunning inside and out. And the whole cast was amazing!" Deepika's husband Ranveer Singh commented on the post with heart emojis.

15.title: I didn't think it'll get over in 3 days: Rohit on Mohali Test win vs Sri Lanka
15.article_body: After India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the Mohali Test, captain Rohit Sharma said he didn't think the match will get over in three days. He added, "It was a great game of cricket from our perspective. We ticked all the boxes we wanted to...A lot of performances, landmark Test match for Virat Kohli."

16.title: Doesn't it smell of Ukrainian blood?: Ukraine as Shell buys Russian oil
16.article_body: After UK oil giant Shell purchased a cargo of Russian crude oil at a record low discount, Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba asked the company, "Doesn't Russian oil smell (of) Ukrainian blood for you?" Defending the purchase, Shell said it would choose alternatives to Russian oil wherever possible and will commit profits from the limited purchase to a dedicated fund.

17.title: 14 killed in collapse of coal mine shaft in China's Guizhou
17.article_body: Fourteen people were killed after the shaft of a coal mine collapsed in China's Guizhou province, state media reported on Sunday. The announcement was made after a rescue operation for the trapped miners ended and their bodies were recovered. Authorities are probing the cause of the accident that took place on February 25.

18.title: Schedule for Indian Premier League 2022 released
18.article_body: The schedule for Indian Premier League 2022 has been released. Defending champions CSK will face IPL 2021 runners-up KKR in the season opener on March 26 at Wankhede Stadium. The last league stage match will take place on May 22 between SRH and PBKS. GT and LSG will play their first-ever IPL match against each other on March 28.

19.title: Ajith Kumar's 'Valimai' earns ₹200 crore worldwide in 10 days
19.article_body: Ajith Kumar's 'Valimai' has crossed the ₹200 crore mark worldwide within 10 days of its release. According to trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, the crime-thriller film has collected ₹202.64 crore so far at the worldwide box office. As per Manobala, this is the fastest ₹200 crore collection for Ajith. 'Valimai' is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor.

20.title: For my birthday this year, I climbed up to Tirupathi on foot: Janhvi
20.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said for her birthday this year, "I climbed up to Tirupathi on foot with my aunt and a friend. I think we all need the blessings of...Gods at a time when we are just breathing free again after the pandemic," she added. "Also, visiting Tirupathi was something my mother loved doing with my Dad," Janhvi said.

21.title: Can't play cross-batted shots on this pitch: Parthiv on SL batters
21.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel questioned the shot selection by Sri Lanka batters in the first Test against India. "I had said that using the sweep shot on this pitch would be dangerous...it's very important to use your feet and play with a straight bat," he stated. "You can't play cross-batted shots on this pitch," he added.

22.title: Woman plays 'What a Wonderful World' as people flee amid war in Ukraine
22.article_body: A video of a pianist playing Louis Armstrong's 'What a Wonderful World' outside Lviv railway station in Ukraine, amid the Russian invasion, has gone viral online. In the video, throngs of refugees are seen milling about behind the woman, reportedly in an attempt to flee eastern Ukraine. A Reuters journalist shared the video, calling the music "hauntingly beautiful".

23.title: 'Baby' maker Neeraj, Sudip to make film inspired by cricketer Pravin Tambe's life
23.article_body: Neeraj Pandey and Shital Bhatia, makers of 'A Wednesday' and 'Baby', have launched a sports dedicated content company 'Bootroom Sports' along with Sudip Tewari. Sudip said they're launching their company with a film inspired by the life of cricketer Pravin Tambe. "He made his international debut at 41 in IPL and is the oldest player in IPL history," he added.

24.title: Given decades to industry, my son should get platform at least: Kishori Shahane
24.article_body: Actress Kishori Shahane said her son should at least be given a chance to be in films even if it's on basis of talent. "My son has been doing theatre since he was a kid...We feel Bobby should be recognised...If we have given decades of our lives to the industry, my son should get a platform, at least," she added.

25.title: Police arrest 3 robbers in Ghaziabad, ₹29,000 & 2 pistols recovered
25.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were arrested on Saturday in Ghaziabad for allegedly robbing people after posing as courier delivery persons. The woman used to supply information to her accomplices about soft targets and she had also trained the duo, the police said. The police have recovered ₹29,000 in cash, two country-made pistols and cartridges from their possession.

26.title: We've successfully managed COVID-19 and Ukraine crisis: PM Modi
26.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India has "successfully managed COVID-19 and now the situation in Ukraine". "Even big countries are facing difficulty in doing so, but it's India's increasing resilience that thousands of students have been evacuated," he said. The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday said India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today.

27.title: Media under attack, journalists should rise to protect their rights: Ex-SC judge
27.article_body: Former Supreme Court judge Justice Madan Bhimarao Lokur has said that media is under attack "in many ways" in the country. "Many journalists have been arrested...for doing their work...Journalists need to stand up to protect their constitutional and fundamental rights," he added. "There are also instances of some journalists being politely asked to toe the line," Justice Lokur added.

28.title: 2nd opium poppy plantation busted in a week in Pune Rural, 1 held
28.article_body: The Pune Rural Police raided a second illegal opium poppy plantation in Shirur Taluka on Saturday, days after conducting a similar action at Indapur taluka. Poppy plants bearing 9 kg pods, worth over ₹4.5 lakh, were seized by police. The farmer was arrested and an FIR under sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act was registered against her.

29.title: Internet backbone provider Cogent shuts its services in Russia
29.article_body: US-based Cogent Communications, an internet backbone provider that carries nearly 25% of global web traffic, is shutting off its services in Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The company cited "economic sanctions" and "the increasingly uncertain security situation" for its decision. Cogent provides internet access and data transport offered over its fiber optic, IP data-only network.

30.title: Line of respect was crossed by the Brazilian crowd: Alexander Zverev
30.article_body: Alexander Zverev said the "line of respect was crossed" by the Brazilian crowd during the 2022 Davis Cup qualifier. Journalist Jose Morgado stated the crowd had taken the name of Olya Sharypova, Zverev's ex-girlfriend who accused Zverev of domestic abuse and violence. "When it gets towards your family members...this is where I draw the line of respect," Zverev added.

31.title: Many congratulations: Laxman on India defeating Pak in Women's WC
31.article_body: Ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman has congratulated India Women for their 107-run win against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup opener on Sunday. "Many congratulations India Women on a comprehensive win against Pakistan and starting the World Cup on a spectacular note. Well played," he tweeted. India Women will play their next match against New Zealand on March 10.

32.title: Will be special to play at my home ground Dunedin for 1st time: Bates
32.article_body: Ahead of New Zealand Women's match against Bangladesh in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand batter Suzie Bates said it'll be special to play the match at University Oval in Dunedin. "It's going to be a pretty cool moment to sing the national anthem and be at your home ground, especially for the first time," she added.

33.title: Visa, Mastercard suspend all operations in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
33.article_body: US payments firms Visa and Mastercard have announced that they will suspend all operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. Both the companies said that cards issued abroad will no longer work at Russian ATMs and cards issued by Russian banks will not be supported by their networks. "We don’t take this decision lightly," said Mastercard in its statement.

34.title: Telangana HC slaps ₹10 lakh fine on filmmaker seeking stay on 'Jhund'
34.article_body: The Telangana High Court has imposed a ₹10 lakh fine on filmmaker Nandi Chinni Kumar who had filed a petition seeking stay on the release of Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund'. The court directed Kumar to pay the amount to PM COVID-19 Relief Fund within a month. This comes after the court was told that Kumar was paid ₹5 crore by makers.

35.title: Two-time Olympic champion Eliud Kipchoge wins Tokyo Marathon
35.article_body: Kenya's two-time Olympic champion and world record holder Eliud Kipchoge won the Tokyo Marathon on Sunday. The Olympic gold medalist clocked 2:02:40, which was over a minute short of his world record mark, in his first Tokyo Marathon race. "It's great to now have won four out of the six Abbott World Marathon Major races," said the 37-year-old athlete.

36.title: Rupinder, Lakra come out of retirement, named in India A probables
36.article_body: Veteran hockey players Rupinder Pal Singh and Birendra Lakra were among the 33 players selected for India 'A' men's core probables on Saturday. The duo had announced their retirement after the Tokyo Olympics last year but with their inclusion in the India 'A' probables, they have made themselves available for selection in the senior national team as well.

37.title: Was shortlisted & rejected many times, almost gave up acting in 2019: Wamiqa
37.article_body: Actress Wamiqa Gabbi, who was seen in Kabir Khan's '83', said that she was rejected for projects a lot of times. "I...got shortlisted...many times and [was] always rejected," she added. Wamiqa further said she almost gave up acting in 2019. "That was the year...I decided maybe this is not meant for me, maybe I'm not a good actor," said Wamiqa.

38.title: Rachakonda Police arrest burglar, seize valuables worth ₹24 lakh
38.article_body: Rachakonda Police arrested a burglar, who was involved in various theft cases, and seized valuables worth ₹24 lakh from him on Friday. The accused, Shaik Yamin, had reportedly stolen gold and silver ornaments, other items and cash worth ₹1.5 lakh from the victim's house in Gousekonda village earlier this month. Three others involved in the burglary are still absconding.

39.title: I have actually been lazy and not open to work in the last few years: Bipasha
39.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said that she has been "lazy and not open to work in last few years". "But the plan is to return to work in 2022 and do something interesting. I hope I can make announcements very soon," she said, adding, "I have started taking up events, otherwise I was  closed down to doing any kind of shooting."

40.title: Won't return from 2021 knee surgery before late summer: Federer
40.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said his tennis comeback from knee surgery last year will not be until at least the late summer. The 40-year-old added that his rehabilitation was progressing good enough that he was now thinking in terms of playing again. Federer hasn't played a competitive match since losing at 2021 Wimbledon quarter-finals.

41.title: Rachakonda Police bust prostitution ring, arrest 2 offenders
41.article_body: Rachakonda Police have arrested two human trafficking offenders for allegedly running a prostitution ring in Jawaharnagar, the police said in a press release issued on Saturday. Police invoked the PD Act against the offender, identified as Uduthala Laxmi, who was arrested along with an associate following a raid. A female victim was also rescued from premises, police added.

42.title: People think we are standing on streets & selling our bodies: Sushant Divgikr
42.article_body: Trans actor Sushant Divgikr spoke about how they still have to struggle for proper representation in society. Sushant said, "Everybody thinks we are...standing on the streets and selling our bodies or begging." "Growing up we've been bullied, hit [and] touched at places we shouldn't have been. I still get called names, so imagine somebody from a smaller town," Sushant added.

43.title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya receives Ukraine-return students in Bengaluru
43.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya received more than 30 Karnataka students who returned from Ukraine at the Bengaluru airport. "Children and their parents have nothing but gratitude for PM Sri Narendra Modi Ji for leading Operation Ganga from the front," said the MP from Bengaluru South Lok Sabha seat. The students returned from Kharkiv in Ukraine.

44.title: Brilliant win: Tendulkar on India's 107-run win vs Pak in 2022 WC
44.article_body: Following India's 107-run win against Pakistan in their first match of 2022 Women's World Cup, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Brilliant win for Team India!" He added, "The partnership between Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar got us back in...game when we were 114/6...best thing the two did was to rotate strike smartly and convert twos into threes...their mindset helped us win."

45.title: He made everything look so simple: Raina on late Aus spinner Warne
45.article_body: Remembering Shane Warne, Suresh Raina said the late Australian spin legend made "everything look so simple", adding his cricketing knowledge was incredible. "I remember watching that Ashes series of 2005-06 in England and remember being in awe of it. It was such a hard-fought series...Warne was at the centre of it," he added. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

46.title: Army holds winter tuition classes for students in J&K villages
46.article_body: The Indian Army organised winter tuition classes in Jammu and Kashmir to nurture young minds. The initiative was started considering the loss of education due to heavy snowfall and sub-zero temperatures in the region. The classes were organised in remote villages of Mandian, Kundian, Naga, etc. "A total of 380 students were part of initiative," said Sabir Khatana, a teacher.

47.title: Out on bail in murder case, man shot dead by nephew in Amritsar
47.article_body: Out on bail in a murder case, a man was shot dead allegedly by his nephew on Saturday at Ghanupur Kale village on the outskirts of Punjab's Amritsar. "The accused, Amandeep Singh, aka Lalla, wanted to take revenge...for his father's murder," the police said. The weapon used in the crime has been recovered by the police.

48.title: Lataji once asked host to introduce me as king of playback: Udit
48.article_body: Singer Udit Narayan has revealed that late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar at a concert asked the host to introduce him as the king of playback singing. "I can never forget that. I am sure I must have done something good to deserve that," the singer said. Lata Mangeshkar passed away on February 6 at the age of 92.

49.title: India beat SL in 3 days, extend unbeaten run against them at home to 21 Tests
49.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the first Test in Mohali to take a 1-0 lead in the two-match Test series. India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja scored 175*(228) and took nine wickets in the match. With the win, India have now extended their unbeaten run against Sri Lanka at home to 21 Test matches.

50.title: Rod Marsh was fearless, Shane Warne was a magical bowler: Elton John
50.article_body: Singer Elton John, in an Instagram post, paid tributes to former Australian cricketers Shane Warne and Rod Marsh, who both passed away this week. "A tragic day for Australian cricket. Two legends passing is heartbreaking," he wrote, adding, "I...played cricket with Rod in Perth. A very special and fearless man. Shane was a magical bowler and such huge fun."

51.title: Govt proactively working on enhancing mass transportation: PM Modi
51.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the government is proactively working on enhancing the means of the mass transport system at a rapid scale as India undergoes rapid urbanisation. "Now, the Metro services have either become operational in more than two dozen cities of the country or they are approaching completions," PM Modi added.

52.title: 23-yr-old man beaten to death over song request to DJ at marriage in UP
52.article_body: A 23-year-old man was beaten to death after dispute over song request made to the DJ at a marriage function in Uttar Pradesh. Reports said one guest asked DJ to play song on repeat. Some guests objected to it and soon two groups got involved in fight. Deceased, who was acting as mediator, was beaten with stick and later died.

53.title: US teacher charged for slapping student, faces up to 2.5yrs in jail
53.article_body: A 61-year-old teacher in US' Indiana has been charged with battery and faces up to 2.5 years in jail after he allegedly slapped a student across the face. The teacher was recently granted immediate retirement following the incident. A video of the incident purportedly shows the accused grabbing the student's backpack, forcing him into a wall and slapping him.

54.title: 2 Dalit children beaten up for touching utensil containing water in MP; 8 booked
54.article_body: A Dalit family was allegedly beaten up by members of the Lodhi community in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh after two children belonging to the family touched a utensil filled with water, police said. Eight people have been booked in this connection. Five of the family members, including the children, sustained injuries and are undergoing treatment at a hospital.

55.title: Pics show PM Narendra Modi buying ticket before his Pune Metro ride
55.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took a ride on the Pune Metro after inaugurating a 12-km stretch of the metro rail project on Sunday. A picture shared by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Modi buying a ticket at the ticket counter before taking a ride from Garware College to Anand Nagar. PM Modi also interacted with school students on the train.

56.title: Billionaire Thiel's Founders Fund raises $5 billion in 2 new funds
56.article_body: Billionaire Peter Thiel co-founded Founders Fund has raised $5 billion across two new funds, bringing its total assets under management to roughly $11 billion. The venture capital firm's new vehicles include a $1.9 billion early-stage fund and a $3.4 billion growth-stage fund. Founded in 2005, Founders Fund has invested in several major startups including Meta, SpaceX, Airbnb and Palantir.

57.title: Ukrainian soldiers marry each other amid war without parents, friends; pic surfaces
57.article_body: Two soldiers belonging to the National Guard of Ukraine got married in the Rivne region amid the Russia-Ukraine war. The National Guard of Ukraine's Twitter handle shared their picture and tweeted that the couple married "without a white dress, friends, parents, but with a delicate bouquet of the bride". It added, "They swore, hugged, and went on to defend Ukraine!"

58.title: Pic of Pakistani fan's poster on Australia's Labuschagne goes viral
58.article_body: A picture of a Pakistani fan holding a poster on Australia's Marnus Labsuchagne during the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi has gone viral on social media. "Beware of Marnus...He will say 'No Run' all day and end up with a 100," the poster read. Labsuchagne is known for shouting 'No Run' at times while batting.

59.title: Jadeja's old interview goes viral after he scores ton, takes 5-wicket haul in same Test
59.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's interview from 2018 went viral after he slammed 175*(228) and took a five-wicket haul against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Mohali. In the interview, Jadeja was asked what cricketing record he would like to have at the end of his career. Jadeja had responded, "A hundred and a five wicket-haul in the same match."

60.title: 300-yr-old mummy of a mermaid-like creature to be studied by Japanese scientists
60.article_body: A group of scientists from Japan's Kurashiki University of Science and the Arts will study a nearly 300-year-old mummy that's in the shape of a 'mermaid'. The mysterious 12-inch creature was allegedly caught in the Pacific Ocean between 1736, 1741. Pictures of the creature show it has pointed teeth and its lower half has scales and a tail-like tapered end.

61.title: Plan was to get to 200: Pooja Vastrakar who helped India score 244/7 vs Pak
61.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar, who scored 67 off 59 balls in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match against Pakistan, has said the plan was to get to 200 as she was told the wicket was slow. Vastrakar came in to bat when India were 114/6 and added 122 runs with Sneh Rana to help India post 244/7.

62.title: Illegal open bar operating in Gurugram shut down after raid
62.article_body: An open bar operating illegally in Gurugram was shut down following a joint raid by the CM’s flying squad and the Excise Department, the police said. The cashier of the establishment was arrested during the raid that was conducted on Saturday night, they added. Over 90 people were found drinking liquor and smoking hookah at the bar during the raid.

63.title: GST Council may raise lowest tax slab from 5% to 8%: Reports
63.article_body: The GST Council may, in its next meeting, raise the lowest tax slab from 5% to 8% and prune the GST exemption list to increase revenues, Moneycontrol reported. A state finance ministers' panel will submit its report by March-end to the Council. The panel may also recommend a three-tier GST structure, with rates at 8%, 18% and 28%.

64.title: Pak cricket captain Bismah Maroof arrives for match with baby in arms, pic viral
64.article_body: A picture of Pakistan’s women's cricket team captain Bismah Maroof is being widely shared on social media after she arrived at the stadium in New Zealand holding her six-month-old baby girl. ICC also shared Maroof's picture. India defeated Pakistan in their first match of the 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand on Sunday.

65.title: I'm grateful to Musk for supporting Ukraine in words and deeds: Zelenskyy
65.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to Twitter to share details of the conversation he had with the world's richest man Elon Musk, and tweeted, "I am grateful to him for supporting Ukraine with words and deeds." He informed that next week, Ukraine will receive another batch of Starlink systems for destroyed cities. "Possible space projects were discussed," Zelenskyy added.

66.title: Centre indifferent to Indians in Ukraine: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
66.article_body: Congress' Lok Sabha leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has criticised the Centre for allegedly displaying "all kinds of apathy and indifference towards Indians" stranded in the war-hit Ukraine. "The (central) government was busy in campaigning for the elections when evacuation [activities] should have been given the top priority," added Chowdhury. He also accused PM Modi of "misleading" Indians.

67.title: UP CM Yogi interacts with Ukraine-returned students in Lucknow
67.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath interacted with students who have returned to India from Ukraine in Lucknow, on Sunday. "Thirty-three new medical colleges and two new AIIMS hospitals have been established in the state. In the next one year, there will be a medical college in every district of the state," CM Yogi added while interacting with the students.

68.title: India begins last leg of evacuation from Ukraine, asks students to reach Budapest
68.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday tweeted that India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today. "All those students staying in their own accommodation (other than arranged by Embassy) are requested to reach Hungaria city centre, Rakoczi Ut 90, Budapest between 10 am-12 pm," said the Embassy.

69.title: Indian student in Ukraine skips 4 flights, gives up luggage for her pet dog
69.article_body: A medical student in Ukraine skipped four special flights until Indian embassy allowed her to fly with her pet dog. Keerthana reached Chennai airport along with her dog 'Candy' on Saturday. She said, "I waited for extra two-three days. Authorities said I can bring my puppy but I will have to let go of my luggage. I said okay."

70.title: FPIs withdraw record ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4
70.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4 amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. This is almost half of the amount FPIs withdrew in February 2022 at ₹35,506 crore, which was the highest amount withdrawn since March 2020. As per depositories data, they pulled out ₹14,721 crore from equities and ₹2,808 crore from the debt segment.

71.title: It was mentally exhausting to play pregnant cop in 'A Thursday': Neha
71.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said it was physically and mentally exhausting for her to play a pregnant cop in 'A Thursday' under extreme weather conditions. She added the biggest challenge was imposed because of COVID-19 as she was shooting the movie during the pandemic. Neha further said that she believes there is no harm in working while a woman is expecting.

72.title: 3 killed, 36 injured as bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
72.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and 36 others injured after a bus carrying labourers overturned in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Saturday night. The private bus was going to Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow from Kawardha in Chhattisgarh. Eight of the injured people were discharged after treatment at a nearby health centre.

73.title: Himachal gets its 1st-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam
73.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has got its first-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam constructed in Una at a cost of ₹16.38 crore. State Rural Development Minister Virender Kanwar said that the dam will help 5,580 citizens living in water-deficient areas through the dry season. The dam will also help recharge around 44 hand pumps and 31 wells that dry up during drought season.

74.title: Burkina Faso forms interim government after military coup in January
74.article_body: Burkina Faso's transitional President Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba has appointed a new government after a military coup in January this year, according to official decree. The government includes 25 ministers, including Defence Minister General Barthelemy Simpore, who had held same position under previous administration. Burkina Faso's military coup was fourth in West Africa in 18 months.

75.title: OTT lets me work with actors who are hungry, not stars: Tigmanshu
75.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that he enjoys working on OTT platforms because he gets to work with actors who are hungry and not stars. The filmmaker further said that the footprint for OTT content is larger which is the fun part. "Earlier only people in our country...[watched] our work...But now somebody in Africa is seeing my work," Tigmanshu added.

76.title: Men should not look pretty, men should look imperfect: John Abraham
76.article_body: Actor John Abraham in an interview has stated that he believes men should not look pretty, adding that men should look imperfect. The actor further said that fitness is a tripod consisting of good food, good exercise and good sleep. A social media user reacted to John's statement, commenting, "John's statements are problematic but no one says anything to him."

77.title: Working women must choose very carefully when to become mother: Kiran
77.article_body: Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi said working women should "very carefully" choose when to become a mother. "You should not marry unless you are economically independent, or unless someone chooses to be homemaker...it is not imposed decision," she said, adding, "My mother ensured I came back home to warm food, warm bed...clean home...children are taken care of while I worked."

78.title: PM Modi inaugurates 100 new electric buses in Pune
78.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated 100 new electric buses at the Baner depot in Pune. Now, the city has 250 electric buses by Olectra. Another 50 buses are ready to join the fleet by March-end. Earlier in the day, PM Modi also inaugurated the Pune metro rail project and took a ride on a metro train.

79.title: Drone carries blood samples from UP’s Meerut to Noida within 1 hour
79.article_body: A private diagnostic lab in Noida used a drone to transport blood samples from Uttar Pradesh's Meerut to Noida within just one hour. The journey would have taken around 2-3 hours by road, as per reports. The drone belonging to Skye Air Mobility carried blood samples inside a temperature-controlled box and covered a distance of 73.6 km.

80.title: What's a no-fly zone & why was Ukraine's demand for it rejected by NATO?
80.article_body: Declaring a no-fly zone over Ukraine, as per the country's demand, would bar all unauthorised aircraft from flying over it. Western nations imposed such restrictions following the 1991 Gulf War, civil war in Bosnia and Herzegovina etc. NATO rejected Ukraine's demand because it would risk a direct military conflict with Russia by forcing NATO pilots to shoot down Russian aircraft.

81.title: That was a thrashing and in a grand style: Sehwag as India beat Pakistan in Women's WC
81.article_body: Reacting to India defeating Pakistan by 107 runs in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "What a spectacular performance by the Indian girls against Pakistan. That was a thrashing and in grand style." He added, "Pooja Vastrakar with a valiant innings, the ever so reliable Sneh Rana's great all-round show & Rajeshwari Gayakwad outstanding with the ball."

82.title: Happy we won against Pak, but there are a lot of things to work on: Mithali
82.article_body: After defeating Pakistan by 107 runs, India Women captain Mithali Raj said she's happy to have won in their Women's ODI WC opener but there are a lot of things they need to work on. "When you lose wickets in the middle order, it puts a lot of pressure," she added. At one point, India were 114/6  in the match.

83.title: Man driving recklessly stopped & hurled abuses in road rage, claims Kemmu; shares pic
83.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu took to his Instagram Stories to urge Mumbai Police to take action against a driver who Kemmu claimed was driving recklessly. Kemmu said that the driver stopped in front of his car, got out, showed middle finger and hurled abuses. Kemmu called the driver's behaviour "obnoxious and pathetic".

84.title: Sonakshi skipped event after taking ₹37 lakh, non-bailable warrant issued: Reports
84.article_body: A non-bailable warrant has been issued against Sonakshi Sinha in a 2019 fraud case regarding the actress not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance, reports said. According to event organiser Pramod Sharma, from UP's Moradabad, Sinha's manager refused to return the money. Moradabad court has reportedly issued a non-bailable warrant against the actress.

85.title: People are educated in Kerala, won't let us make bad films: Aashiq Abu
85.article_body: Filmmaker Aashiq Abu said that the audience of Kerala won't let filmmakers make bad films. "Every industry has good films and bad films, but in Kerala, people are educated...have access to world cinema. The audiences are very critical and strict there...We can't afford to make a mediocre film...year by year, writers and directors are pushing their limits," he added.

86.title: Zelenskyy invites world's richest man Elon Musk to visit Ukraine; shares video
86.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on a video call with Elon Musk invited the world's richest man to visit Ukraine. "So, If you have time after the war, you are very welcome, I invite you," Zelenskyy told Musk. In a video clip shared by Zelenskyy on Instagram, Musk responded, "That sound's good, I look forward to visiting once things are..."

87.title: Ashwin overtakes Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket
87.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin has become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket. The 35-year-old off-spinner achieved the feat after taking his 435th wicket in Test cricket by dismissing Sri Lanka's Charith Asalanka in their second innings in the first Test in Mohali. Ashwin overtook former India captain Kapil Dev, who had taken 434 wickets in Test cricket.

88.title: Unarmed Ukrainians shout 'go home' as they march towards Russian soldiers
88.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed unarmed civilians marching towards a group of armed Russian soldiers in a street in Ukraine's Melitopol. In the clip, the soldiers can be seen firing in order to disperse the approaching crowd. The locals can also be heard shouting at the soldiers and asking them to "go home".

89.title: Heartbreaking to see places where we shot being bombed: Vishwesh on Ukraine
89.article_body: Filmmaker Vishwesh Krishnamoorthy, who spent time in Ukraine while working on his film '99 Songs', said that it is heartbreaking to see places where they filmed being bombed or destroyed. "I have...friends in Ukraine who were part of crew...It is difficult to read updates from my friends...can't imagine that we are in 2022 and war is real thing," he added.

90.title: Russian hackers are attacking our websites nonstop, says Ukraine
90.article_body: Russian hackers have been attacking Ukrainian websites, including that of the President and the defence ministry, "nonstop" since Russia launched an invasion of the country, Ukraine's cyber watchdog agency said. "The most powerful attacks exceeded 100 Gbps at their peak. Despite all the involved enemy's resources, the sites of...central governmental bodies are available," it added.

91.title: PM Modi inaugurates Pune Metro, pics show him interacting with school students on train
91.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated Pune Metro Rail Project. A tweet from the Prime Minister's Twitter account showed pictures of him interacting with school students on train. It read, "On board the Pune Metro with my young friends." The inaugural event for the 12-km stretch of the total 32.2-km long project took place at the Garware Metro Station.

92.title: Karamyogi of country: Amit Shah on CISF's 53rd Raising Day ceremony
92.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah thanked the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) for being the 'Karamyogi' of the country. "During COVID-19 pandemic when Indians were coming back from abroad, CISF personnel took risks in taking care of fellow Indians and even lost their lives," Shah added. He attended the 53rd Raising Day celebrations of CISF at Indirapuram, Ghaziabad.

93.title: Drunk man kills colleague after fight over repayment of ₹100 loan in Mumbai
93.article_body: A 35-year-old man was bludgeoned to death with a cement block allegedly by his colleague in Mumbai over repayment of ₹100, police said. According to police, the victim, who used to do odd jobs in the locality, had borrowed ₹100 from the accused. "The two were in an inebriated state and had a fight over the loan," an officer said.

94.title: France accused UK of 'lack of humanity' for Ukrainian refugees: AFP
94.article_body: French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin in a letter to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel said that the latter's country's response "lacked humanity" towards Ukrainian refugees, reported AFP. He added that 150 Ukrainian refugees who wanted to join their families in UK were turned away at France's Calais. He also urged the UK to set up a consular presence in Calais.

95.title: Delhi Jal Board to lay 575 km of sewage lines, aims to clean Yamuna
95.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has approved the laying of 575km long sewage lines in unauthorised colonies along with three other projects. DJB chairperson Satyendar Jain said that these lines will carry wastewater from several areas including Sangam Vihar and Sarangpur. The projects, including the installation of an interceptor sewer line at the Barapullah drain, are aimed at cleaning the Yamuna.

96.title: British intelligence services used Grindr to track Russian soldiers: Reports
96.article_body: British intelligence services reportedly monitored the Russian invasion of Ukraine by tracking the soldiers’ use of apps like the gay dating app Grindr and VKontakte, the Russian equivalent for Facebook. The intelligence services gave the information to Ukraine to help them amid the conflict.  Russian President Vladimir Putin had banned Grindr in 2013, but the app is still used discreetly.

97.title: One can stay away from it by focusing on goal: Ajay on dealing with negativity
97.article_body: Ajay Devgn opened up about how he deals with negativity coming his way and said, "You can't change the way people think. It is their prerogative." "One can stay away from negativity by focusing on the goal," he added. Ajay was recently seen in the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and the web show 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness'.

98.title: Mandhana becomes 4th Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs
98.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana scored her 21st half-century against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match to become the fourth Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs. Mithali Raj, Anjum Chopra and Harmanpreet Kaur are the three other Indian women batters who have achieved the feat. Mandhana has now scored 2,513 runs in 65 ODIs.

99.title: Were released only after I called Amit Shah: Union Min Narayan Rane
99.article_body: After being interrogated for nine hours by Mumbai Police on Saturday in connection with Disha Salian's death case, Union Minister Narayan Rane said that he was released after he called Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Rane, whose son Nitesh was also interrogated, said, "Disha Salian did not die by suicide but was murdered. Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar provoked Salian's mother."

100.title: Pune Metro to start on 2 routes today, min fare is ₹10
100.article_body: The Pune Metro trains will be available for the public after 3 pm today. The trains will currently operate on two routes namely Vanaz-Garware College and PCMC-Phugewalu Metro Station. The minimum fare is ₹10 while the maximum is ₹20. From tomorrow, the metro will operate from 8 am to 9 pm at a frequency of 30 minutes.

101.title: We will miss you: Anupam as co-star Parineeti wraps up 'Uunchai' shoot
101.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share that actress Parineeti Chopra has completed shooting for Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "It has been an absolute pleasure working with you #Pari...Stay happy till we meet again! We will MISS you!! Love and prayers always," he wrote. Anupam also shared a video wherein he praised the actress and said that she's full of life.

102.title: Internet services to be suspended in parts of Bengal between March 7 & 16
102.article_body: Mobile internet and broadband services in several regions of West Bengal will be temporarily suspended to prevent unlawful activities, as per an order issued by the state government. The services will remain suspended in a few blocks of Malda, Murshidabad, Uttar Dinajpur, Cooch Behar, Jalpaiguri, Birbhum and Darjeeling between 11 am and 3.15 pm during March 7-9, 11-12 and 14-16.

103.title: He used his points to upgrade me to first class on flight in 1997: Gilchrist on Warne
103.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist said, "His generosity, underestimated by those who didn’t know him, was a strong suit of Warnie's." He added, "I remember flying home with...injury after...Old Trafford Test in 1997 and Warnie was on...same flight because his daughter...was born. We flew home together...He used his points to upgrade me to first class."

104.title: PM Modi unveils 9.5-ft tall statue of Shivaji Maharaj in Pune
104.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at the Pune Municipal Corporation on Sunday. The statue, which is about 9.5 feet tall, is made up of 1,850 kg of gunmetal. Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, Leader of Opposition Devendra Fadnavis and Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol also attended the event.

105.title: India asks its nationals in Ukraine to give their details on urgent basis, shares form
105.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has asked all Indian nationals who still remain in Ukraine to give their details to the embassy on an urgent basis for evacuation purposes. It shared a form on Twitter and asked the nationals to fill it up urgently. "Be Safe Be Strong," the embassy wrote. Ukraine-Russia war entered its 11th day today.

106.title: He's turning everything into gold: Sachin on Jadeja's performance vs SL
106.article_body: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar has praised all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his performance in the ongoing Mohali Test against Sri Lanka. "Jadeja is turning everything into gold, wonderful performance," tweeted Sachin. Jadeja scored 175* during India's first innings and then picked five wickets to help bundle out Sri Lanka for 174 in their first innings.

107.title: Man helps rescue 2 girls after kidnapper boards his e-rickshaw in Delhi
107.article_body: A 40-year-old drug addict was arrested for kidnapping two girls, aged seven and four, after Brahmdutt Rajput, an e-rickshaw driver in Delhi, complained to police about him. Reports said Rajput informed police that a person with two small girls boarded his e-rickshaw from Balaji temple in Vivek Vihar towards Chintamani chowk. Rajput also said behaviour of the accused was "strange".

108.title: Man sends obscene videos to female lawyers, police officers; held in B'luru
108.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 37-year-old man for allegedly harassing female lawyers and police officers by sending obscene videos and messages to them. Police said that at least 14 cases were registered against him and that he had sent messages and videos to around 100 women. The man reportedly went by different names.

109.title: T'gana Guv criticises TRS for not starting session with her address
109.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Saturday criticised the TRS-led state government's decision to start the Budget session without her address, saying that it was "unfortunate" that the state government was quoting a "technical reason" to avoid it. She added that by not holding the address, members will lose the opportunity to discuss the state government's previous year performance.

110.title: Constable opens fire inside BSF mess in Punjab, 5 jawans including shooter dead
110.article_body: Five soldiers of the Border Security Force (BSF) lost their lives in a fratricide incident at the BSF mess in Amritsar, Punjab on Sunday. Constable Satteppa SK, who opened fire on his colleagues, was also killed in the incident. One of the injured is critical and a court of inquiry has been ordered to ascertain the facts, said the BSF.

111.title: Arjun wishes Janhvi on 25th b'day, says 'Now you're stuck with me'
111.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to wish her sister-actress, Janhvi Kapoor, on her 25th birthday. Sharing a black and white picture with Janhvi, Arjun wrote, "I know I wasn't around for quite a few birthdays but now you're stuck with me for life." Meanwhile, Janhvi's sister Khushi Kapoor, too, shared a post for her and wrote, "Happy Birthday my everything."

112.title: Hardcore Maoist involved in raising funds & recruiting cadre held in Bihar
112.article_body: A hardcore Maoist, Ramdular Yadav, who was allegedly active in extorting contractors and businessmen and involved in expanding the ultra-base, was arrested in Bihar on Friday, officials said. "Yadav had been active for a decade and was raising funds and recruiting cadres to strengthen the extremist organisation on the Kaimur plateau," Superintendent of Police (SP), Ashish Bharti, said.

113.title: Shah Rukh, Deepika, John Abraham fly to Spain for 'Pathaan' shoot
113.article_body: Actors Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham have reportedly flown to Spain for the shooting of their upcoming film 'Pathaan'. Shah Rukh was spotted at the Mumbai airport on Friday night, while Deepika was seen at the airport in an all-red ensemble on Saturday. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, is scheduled to release on January 25, 2023.

114.title: He was born for this, I was endlessly impressed: Sean Penn on Ukraine President Zelenskyy
114.article_body: Academy Award-winning actor Sean Penn, who was in Ukraine to film a documentary on Russia-Ukraine conflict, opened up about meeting Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on the day of invasion. “I don’t know if he knew that he was born for this...I was endlessly impressed and moved by him and terrified for him and for Ukraine," he added.

115.title: India defeat Pakistan in Women's World Cup again, extend 100% win record to 4-0
115.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by 107 runs in their first match of 2022 Women's World Cup in Mount Maunganui on Sunday. With this, India extended their 100% winning run against Pakistan in Women's World Cup history to four matches. The match witnessed Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar register the highest seventh-wicket partnership (122 runs) in women's ODI cricket history.

116.title: Will send BBMP chief to jail if he defies waste dumping order: HC
116.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Saturday said that Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta will be sent to jail if he can't follow its order against waste dumping at Mittaganahalli quarry. It also asked Gupta to file an affidavit as to why its order is being disregarded. "We've been watching [Gupta's] conduct...This isn't the first case," it said.

117.title: Even Pakistani student trying to grab Indian flag to escape Ukraine: UP Deputy CM
117.article_body: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Even a Pakistani student is trying to grab an Indian flag to escape Ukraine." This is not a simple achievement, Maurya added. " I feel proud that in the war between Russia and Ukraine, Indian students are being evacuated safely," Maurya stated.

118.title: Tattoo artist in Kochi arrested after multiple women allege sexual assault
118.article_body: Sujeesh PS, a popular tattoo artist in Kerala's Kochi, was arrested on Saturday night for allegedly sexually assaulting multiple women. So far, Kerala Police has registered at least six cases of sexual assault against him. Police said Sujeesh had been absconding for the last four days after an 18-year-old girl, in a post on social media, claimed she was raped.

119.title: Customer stabs fruit seller to death over money transaction in Mumbai
119.article_body: A customer stabbed a fruit seller to death over money transaction in Mumbai's Null Bazar area on Saturday. "Sohrab Qureshi (25) had dispute with fruit seller over money transaction after which...he stabbed fruit seller Babuji Qureshi (55)...and attacked his son Chhotu Qureshi (30). Babuji died on spot while Chhotu has been admitted to JJ Hospital for treatment," an official said.

120.title: I see a lot more of him in me, he taught me to live life: Shaheer on father
120.article_body: Actor Shaheer Sheikh said that his late father taught him to live life. "No one can fill the space he left behind in my life...Now I see a lot more of him in me...I would want to carry on legacy...keep doing stuff he used to like and used to do," Shaheer said, adding his father lived how he wanted to.

121.title: Ludhiana man accused of abducting assaults & molests victim’s mother
121.article_body: A man who is accused of abducting a youth and thrashing him assaulted the latter’s mother after barging in their house in Ludhiana on Friday, Raikot Police said. According to the woman, the accused tore her clothes and also molested her. The accused man had been forcing her to withdraw the kidnapping case which she had lodged against him.

122.title: Ukraine making nuclear 'Dirty Bomb' in Chernobyl, claims Russia media
122.article_body: Russian media has cited an unnamed source as saying that Ukraine was close to building a plutonium-based "dirty bomb" nuclear weapon without any evidence. The TASS, RIA and Interfax news agencies quoted "a representative of a competent body" in Russia as saying Ukraine was developing nuclear weapons at the destroyed Chernobyl nuclear power plant that was shut down in 2000.

123.title: Ricky Ponting breaks down while paying tribute to Shane Warne, video surfaces
123.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting broke down while paying tribute to Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 on Friday. "He is going to go down as one of the all-time greats of the game if not the greatest. I have never played with or against a better bowler," he added. He further said Warne revolutionised spin bowling.

124.title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar govt on groundwater contamination in 31 districts
124.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to Bihar government over reports claiming that groundwater in 31 of Bihar's 38 districts is contaminated with arsenic, fluoride and iron, officials said. The NHRC said it has taken suo motu cognisance of a media report quoting the recent Bihar Economic Survey report 2021-22, which was tabled in the Assembly.

125.title: My husband enjoys the love track in Anupamaa; he's my ardent supporter: Rupali
125.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly, who features in 'Anupamaa', said her husband enjoys the love track in the show. "My husband is loving the present romantic track between Anuj Kapadia and Anupamaa. We both watch the show together. He's my biggest critic as well as my biggest supporter." "He catches...little nuances and tells me that I could've done this better," she added.

126.title: Rohit would've definitely communicated with Jadeja: Jaffer on India's 1st innings
126.article_body: Reacting to captain Rohit Sharma's criticism on social media for declaring India's first innings at 574/8 when Ravindra Jadeja was batting at 175, Wasim Jaffer said it's not possible that players didn't know when they would declare. "Rohit would've definitely communicated with Jadeja...To make 25 runs, you definitely need 30-45 minutes. So...maybe they declared early," Jaffer added.

127.title: I love Shawn, we're learning to be healthy adults: Camila on breakup
127.article_body: Songwriter-singer Camila Cabello said she has nothing but love for her ex-boyfriend and songwriter-singer Shawn Mendes. "I love Shawn...And I feel like there is literally nothing but love for him," she said, adding, "We both started so young too, we're really learning how to be healthy adults. And that sometimes means not having your number one focus be career."

128.title: President Kovind flags off fitness run at Rashtrapati Bhavan
128.article_body: As a part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, President Ram Nath Kovind and First Lady Savita Kovind flagged off a fitness run at the Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi on Sunday. "Along with the President, senior officials and staff of the President's Secretariat participated in the run," the President of India tweeted.

129.title: TN court convicts 10 people in 2015 Dalit man beheading case
129.article_body: A court in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has convicted 10 of the 17 accused of killing a 21-year-old Dalit man whose headless body was found on railway tracks in 2015. The accused, who belong to the Gounder community, had allegedly killed the deceased on seeing him talking to a girl from their community. The prime accused is a caste-centric outfit's leader.

130.title: Eco Mitra Park with artworks made from tyres, bottles opened in Delhi
130.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has started an Eco Mitra Park in Delhi's Sarita Vihar. "Through the initiative, SDMC has been promoting the principle of 3Rs which is reduce, reuse and recycle as beautiful artworks have been made from old tyres, bottles, unused items at this park," an SDMC official said, adding park aims at making people aware.

131.title: Sophie Turner, Joe Jonas expecting their second child: Reports
131.article_body: Actress Sophie Turner and her husband, singer Joe Jonas, are expecting their second child together, according to reports. The couple had welcomed their first child, Willa, two years ago. "They both have siblings and didn't want their daughter to be an only child. The couple recently celebrated Sophie's birthday, as well as the pregnancy," a source told ET.

132.title: Kerala restaurant takes 'Russian Salad' off its menu in solidarity with Ukraine
132.article_body: A restaurant in Kerala's Fort Kochi named Kashi Art Cafe has put up a noticeboard in front of the restaurant reading, "In solidarity with the people of Ukraine, we have removed 'RUSSIAN SALAD' from our menu." The restaurant owner said the gesture was meant to condemn the attack being carried out by Russia on the innocent people of Ukraine.

133.title: B.Tech graduate arrested for snatching 64-yr-old woman's purse in Chandigarh
133.article_body: A 25-year-old B.Tech graduate from Himachal Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly snatching the purse of a 64-year-old woman in a market in Chandigarh. The victim reportedly received a fracture in one arm after she fell while chasing him. "The accused is a drug addict. He snatched the purse to get the money to buy drugs," a police officer said.

134.title: Sathyaraj is my lucky mascot: 'Baahubali', 'Mirchi' co-star Prabhas
134.article_body: Prabhas has said veteran actor Sathyaraj is his "lucky mascot". "I worked with him in 'Mirchi' which was a super hit and then 'Baahubali', a blockbuster hit," he added. Prabhas, who will be seen alongside Sathyaraj in the upcoming film 'Radhe Shyam', further said, "I am confident that 'Radhe Shyam' is going to be yet another milestone in our career."

135.title: We had never heard of 'flipper', and then Warne used it to set us up with it: Nasser
135.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, was arguably the greatest cricketer. "There was never a dull moment when Warne had the ball," he added. "Leg spin was a dying art before Warne; we had never heard of a 'flipper', and then suddenly he used to set us up with it," Nasser recalled.

136.title: Mithali Raj becomes first-ever woman cricketer to feature in 6 ODI World Cups
136.article_body: By featuring in India's 2022 Women's World Cup opener against Pakistan, captain Mithali Raj became the first-ever woman cricketer to feature in six ODI World Cups. Mithali made her ODI World Cup debut in 2000 and also played in 2005, 2009, 2013 and 2017 editions. Among male cricketers, only Javed Miandad and Sachin Tendulkar have featured in six World Cups.

137.title: Mayank, Sanah decided their own wedding rituals & decor: Seema Pahwa
137.article_body: Actress Seema Pahwa said her son Mayank Pahwa and Sanah Kapur's wedding was kept an intimate affair because of the pandemic. She added that the rituals in their wedding weren't specific to any one type and the couple came up with their own set of rituals. Seema further revealed that the decor was also decided by Mayank and Sanah.

138.title: Minor girls playing after school killed as speeding truck hits them in Maha
138.article_body: Two girls, aged five and nine, were killed after a speeding truck hit them in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Saturday. Police said that the girls were playing after school when the incident took place. An official said that the truck also hit a tree and caught fire and that the driver was caught when he attempted to run away.

139.title: Ravindra Jadeja takes 5 wickets after scoring 175* as India bowl Sri Lanka out for 174
139.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took his 10th five-wicket haul in Test cricket as India bowled Sri Lanka out for 174 runs in 65 overs in their first innings in the first Test in Mohali. Jadeja registered bowling figures of 13-4-41-5 after having scored his Test career-best score of 175*(228). India have enforced follow-on after taking first-innings lead of 400.

140.title: Walked around with story in head for yrs, saw my Gangubai in Alia: Bhansali
140.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he walked around with Gangubai's story in his head for many years. "Many thought I was making a mistake in casting Alia in Gangubai Kathiawadi, that she was too petite for the role. But I saw my Gangubai in Alia. And she gave her all, and then some more to the role," he added.

141.title: US senators share pics of Zelenskyy after being 'asked not to'; criticised
141.article_body: US Representative Dean Phillips on Saturday criticised two US senators for sharing pictures of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, saying that it was "reckless" and that the Ukrainian Ambassador had "asked each of us on [zoom call] to not share anything on social media". While Zelenskyy himself shared pictures of the zoom call later, his live location is being kept secret.

142.title: Ukrainian statehood at risk, Western sanctions akin to declaring war: Putin
142.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin continued to blame Ukrainian leadership for the war and slammed their resistance to the invasion. "If they continue to do what they are doing, they are calling into question the future of Ukrainian statehood," he said. Putin also hit out at Western sanctions, saying, "These sanctions that are being imposed, they are akin to declaring war."

143.title: As captain or coach, you don't think too much about individual glory: Karthik
143.article_body: Supporting India's decision to declare their innings at 574/8 with Ravindra Jadeja batting on 175, Dinesh Karthik said the management takes the call considering how much is left before stumps. "When you are on 195-196, then you think twice. Other than that, as a captain or coach, you're not thinking too much about individual glory," he added.

144.title: Inter-state child trafficking racket busted in Ahmedabad, 9 held for abducting infant
144.article_body: Police in Ahmedabad busted an inter-state child trafficking racket and nine people were arrested for their alleged involvement in the kidnapping of a four-month-old infant girl. The abducted infant was allegedly sold off to couples. The infant was sold to agents twice, first in Vadodara and then in Hyderabad for ₹2 lakh before being retrieved by the police in Surat.

145.title: SP, BJP fought UP polls on issues similar to Congress: Bhupesh Baghel
145.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that Samajwadi Party (SP) and BJP fought UP elections on issues similar to Congress. His statement came hours after campaigning for the seventh and final phase of the UP Assembly elections concluded on Saturday. "For the first time, SP, BJP had to leave their issues and come to our issues," Baghel added.

146.title: Aamir has a big heart, he calls new directors & watches their films: Nagraj
146.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule, whose 'Jhund' starring Amitabh Bachchan recently released in theatres, has said Aamir Khan has a big heart as he calls new directors and watches their films and appreciates them. "For 'Jhund', he took out a lot of time, saw it, and discussed it with us the whole night," Nagraj said, adding, "His opinion is important to me."

147.title: Shane Warne had just finished 'ridiculous' 14-day diet: Manager on ex-cricketer's demise
147.article_body: Late Australian spin legend Shane Warne's manager James Erskine has revealed that Warne had finished a "ridiculous" 14-day diet before his death. "He did go on these ridiculous sorts of diets...where he basically only ate fluids for 14 days and he’d done this three or four times," Erskine said. He further said that Warne suffered a "massive heart attack".

148.title: Kiara shares pictures from her sister Ishita Advani's wedding
148.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, actress Kiara Advani shared pictures from her sister Ishita Advani's wedding. In one of the pictures, Kiara was seen performing the bridesmaid's duties as Ishita got ready for her wedding. Kiara was seen marking with kohl on her sister's neck. Alongside the photo, Kiara wrote, "Nazar na lage (Let no one's evil eye be on you)."

149.title: Hoardings criticising PM Modi removed ahead of his visit to Pune
149.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Pune, the Nuisance Prevention Squad of Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) has removed the 'Go Back Modi' hoardings put up by Congress city unit on Saturday. The hoardings sponsored by the BJP were left up. Congress leader Mohan Joshi condemned the action and said that black flags will be waved during the PM's visit.

150.title: Nearly 205 tortoises seized from toilet of Delhi-bound train in Bihar
150.article_body: Nearly 205 tortoises, including those of an endangered species, were seized from a Delhi-bound train at Narkatiaganj railway station in Bihar's West Champaran district, officials said. The tortoises were found concealed inside four pillow covers in a toilet on the Satyagraha Express, Narkatiaganj SHO said. "We have handed over the tortoises to the wildlife authorities," the SHO added.

151.title: Stay inside, avoid unnecessary risks: Govt after students' viral video from Ukraine
151.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs said it is concerned about Indian students in Sumy, Ukraine after a video went viral in which the students said that they were risking their lives and moving towards the border. The ministry said, "Have advised our students to take safety precautions, stay inside shelters and avoid unnecessary risks."

152.title: Unjust: TN Min as K'taka allocates ₹1,000 cr for Mekedatu project
152.article_body: Tamil Nadu Water Resources Minister Duraimurugan on Saturday criticised the Karnataka government for allocating ₹1,000 crore for Mekedatu project in its Budget, saying that it is "unjust" as it hadn't taken the concurrence of riparian states for building the reservoir across river Cauvery. He added that the project went against the principles of federalism and a Supreme Court judgement.

153.title: Puducherry's iconic Rock Beach pier partially collapses due to high waves
153.article_body: Puducherry's iconic pier at Rock Beach collapsed partially because of high waves caused by a deep depression over the Bay of Bengal on Saturday night. Meanwhile, India Meteorological Department has predicted light to moderate rainfall/thundershower at a few places with heavy rainfall at isolated places over north coastal Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Karaikal on March 6.

154.title: Error found in Maha HSC Class 12 exam paper; students to get 1 mark each
154.article_body: An erroneous question was found printed in the English language paper of Class 12 Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination. Following this, the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has announced that it will grant one mark to every student who attempted the question. Approximately 14 lakh students across Maharashtra took the exam on March 4.

155.title: Chelsea beat Burnley 4-0, Aston Villa beat Southampton 4-0 in PL
155.article_body: Germany's Kai Havertz scored twice on Saturday as Chelsea beat Burnley 4-0 in the Premier League, while Aston Villa beat Southampton 4-0. Elsewhere, Ivan Toney scored a hat-trick as Brentford beat Norwich City 3-1 and Newcastle United beat Brighton 2-1. Leicester City beat Leeds United 1-0 and Crystal Palace beat Wolves 2-0. Manchester City faces Manchester United on Sunday.

156.title: Sneh-Pooja's record partnership helps India set Pakistan 245-run target in Women's WC
156.article_body: India have set a target of 245 for Pakistan to chase in their first 2022 Women's World Cup match. India, who were 114-6 after 33.1 overs, managed to put up a total of 244/7. Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar shared a partnership of 122 runs, which is the highest seventh-wicket partnership in women's ODI cricket history.

157.title: Ghaziabad's industries to file plea against conversion to PNG fuel
157.article_body: Unsatisfied with the state pollution control board's notice to mandatory convert to Piped Natural Gas (PNG) or biomass fuel supply by September 30, several industrial units have decided to file representations with the UP government. Notably, the order was issued to "390 air polluting industrial units" in the Ghaziabad district on directions of the Commission for Air Quality Management.

158.title: My cats are my life, could not leave them behind: Ukraine returnee
158.article_body: An Indian student who returned from Ukraine said that he could not leave his pet cats behind. "Indian embassy helped...me in bringing back...my pets with me. My cats are my life...I request everyone to bring back...pets with them," he said. Earlier, another student had refused to leave Ukraine after being unable to get NOC from government to bring his dog.

159.title: Ludhiana woman found hanging at home, husband & in-laws booked for abetting suicide
159.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was found hanging in Ludhiana’s Dhillon Nagar on Friday, when she was alone at home. Her father has alleged that she was harassed by her husband and in-laws, who used to accuse her of not performing daily chores properly. Police have booked her husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law for abetting her suicide.

160.title: Me & my family were mercilessly trolled, we were in shock: Majumdar on Saha controversy
160.article_body: While revealing that his lawyers will be serving Wriddhiman Saha a defamation notice over the WhatsApp chat controversy, journalist Boria Majumdar said, "As a result of what Saha did, me and my family...were mercilessly trolled." He added, "[People heaped] abuse on them for days on end...It was very difficult for me to take that. We were all in shock."

161.title: Felt embarrassed, wouldn't do it today: Jamie on filming nude scene
161.article_body: Actress Jamie Lee Curtis said in an interview that she felt embarrassed doing the nude scene in the 1983 film 'Trading Places'. "Did I like doing it? No...Did I know what I was doing? Yeah...Was I doing it because it was the job? Yes," she added. The 63-year-old actress further said she "would absolutely not" appear naked on screen today.

162.title: I personally feel I let the team down during Ashes 2021-22: Ben Stokes
162.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said he let a lot of people down during their 0-4 defeat in Ashes 2021-22. "I let the team down with more than just performances, I would have liked to have been in better physical shape," he added. Stokes scored a total of 236 runs and picked just four wickets in five Tests.

163.title: Putin must fail: UK PM Boris as he sets out action plan for Ukraine
163.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson is set to launch a six-point action plan in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, his office said on Saturday. "[Russian President Vladimir Putin] must fail and must be seen to fail in this act of aggression," Johnson said. The objectives of the plan include an international humanitarian coalition for Ukraine and economic pressure on Moscow.

164.title: Ukraine shares pic of woman carrying rifle while walking with child, says 'Wonder Woman'
164.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a woman carrying a rifle while walking with a child on a street amid war in Ukraine and termed her a 'Wonder Woman'. "Every Ukrainian mother deserves to be called a Wonder Woman," the tweet read. Russia-Ukraine war entered its 11th day today.

165.title: India reports 5,476 new COVID-19 cases and 158 deaths
165.article_body: India has recorded 5,476 new COVID-19 cases and 158 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,921 cases and 289 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 59,442, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,036.

166.title: Pic of fan's poster reading 'I won't get married until Virat scores his 71st' goes viral
166.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a poster dedicated to Virat Kohli at the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association in Mohali has gone viral. The poster reads, "I will not get married until Virat scores his 71st." Kohli, who has hit 70 international hundreds, last scored an international ton in November 2019.

167.title: UP's future safe in Akhilesh Yadav's hands, says Mayank Joshi after joining SP
167.article_body: BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi's son, Mayank Joshi, who joined the Samajwadi Party (SP) on Saturday said that UP's future will be safe in former CM Akhilesh Yadav's hands. "Akhilesh Yadav talks about development, women's safety and youth. As a youth, I thought to stand with such a person who talks progressively," Mayank added.

168.title: 230 passengers stranded in Gurez valley due to bad weather airlifted
168.article_body: As many as 230 stranded passengers were airlifted to and fro Gurez valley in J&K’s Bandipora on Saturday. "The passengers were stranded due to bad weather," Deputy Commissioner, Bandipora, Owais Ahmad, said. There were 84 candidates among the passengers who were expected to appear in the J&K Services Selection Board (JKSSB) examination on Sunday.

169.title: Union Minister, son questioned for over 8 hrs in Disha Salian defamation case
169.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane and his son MLA Nitesh Rane were questioned at Malvani police station in Mumbai for over eight hours on Saturday. The interrogation was regarding a case registered against them for allegedly making defamatory statements about the death of Disha Salian, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's former manager. Salian allegedly died by suicide on June 8, 2020.

170.title: I followed RR religiously due to presence of Shane Warne: Chahal
170.article_body: Paying his tribute to Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said the ex-Australia spinner was his idol. "Till the time I didn't join IPL, the first three years, I followed Rajasthan Royals religiously and I watched every single match because of Warne," revealed Chahal. Warne played 55 matches for the RR between 2008 and 2011.

171.title: Dealer steals car days after selling it in Punjab, manhunt launched
171.article_body: A car dealer and his aide stole a car that the dealer had sold off to a man in Punjab's Ludhiana. Reports said that ₹1.7 lakh and other documents were kept in the car. Police said that accused said they would return the car and documents but did not turn up. Police has launched a manhunt to catch the accused.

172.title: Call on India to appeal to Russia to stop fire and allow civilians to leave: Ukraine
172.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has called on the governments of India, China and Nigeria to appeal to Russia to stop the fire and allow civilians to leave. Kuleba claimed that humanitarian corridors and ceasefires don't exist because Russian forces violated the agreement to arrange humanitarian corridors. Notably, around 13,300 people returned to India from Ukraine under Operation Ganga.

173.title: Sidharth always wanted to see me happy: Shehnaaz Gill
173.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Saturday shared the trailer of her upcoming chat show, 'Shape of You'. The trailer features several celebrities, including 'Bigg Boss 13' fame Shehnaaz Gill. In the trailer, Shehnaaz can also be seen talking about her friend, late-actor Sidharth Shukla. Shehnaaz said, "Sidharth mujhe hamesha haste hue dekhna chahta tha. (Sidharth always wanted to see me happy)."

174.title: 'Dark Shadows', 'Lethal Weapon' actor Mitchell Ryan passes away at 88
174.article_body: 'Dark Shadows' actor Mitchell Ryan passed away on Friday at the age of 88. He died of congestive heart failure at his home in Los Angeles, his stepdaughter Denise Freed told The Hollywood Reporter. Mitchell was known for his work in 'Dharma & Greg' and movies including 'Lethal Weapon', 'Liar Liar' and 'Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers'.
