175.title: It took me 30 years to understand I am trans: Sushant Divgikr
175.article_body: Trans actor Sushant Divgikr said that it took them 30 years to understand they were trans. "I don't expect everyone to understand everything...but respect us even from distance. Just respect us," Sushant said, adding, "Now, I am gender-fluid, trans person. I have both the energies in me." "Everybody thinks we are standing on streets and selling our bodies," Sushant added.

176.title: Family attacked by neighbours for objecting to buffaloes kept on road in Delhi
176.article_body: Six people, including five members of a family, were injured after they were attacked with iron rods, sticks and concrete bricks allegedly by nearly 20 people belonging to another family in the neighbourhood in Delhi's New Ashok Nagar. The clash took place after an argument broke out between the two families over keeping buffaloes on road, near the victims' house.

177.title: Domestic help steals cash, jewellery worth ₹9 lakh in Pune; 2 held
177.article_body: A domestic help and her husband have been arrested after she allegedly stole cash and jewellery worth over ₹9 lakh from her employer's house in Pune. The accused couple had initially gone absconding after an FIR was filed against them. The domestic help claimed she did so to take "revenge" because her employer didn't give her salary on time.

178.title: Boria Majumdar accuses Saha of tampering screenshot of WhatsApp chat, shares pics
178.article_body: Days after cricketer Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of a WhatsApp chat alleging that a journalist threatened him, journalist Boria Majumdar accused Saha of tampering screenshot of their WhatsApp chat. He added that it has damaged his reputation and credibility. Majumdar further said that he didn't threaten Saha and stated that his lawyers are serving a defamation notice to Saha.

179.title: Large amount of blood found in Shane Warne's room after CPR, says Thai police
179.article_body: Police in Thailand said that a large amount of blood was found in Shane Warne's room at a villa in Thailand. "When CPR was started...the deceased had coughed up liquid and was bleeding," the police added. Various reports claim blood stains were seen on the carpet and on three towels and a pillow. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

180.title: B'luru records less than 300 new COVID-19 cases for 7 days in a row
180.article_body: Bengaluru has recorded less than 300 new coronavirus cases for seven days in a row with 182 new cases on Saturday, according to official data. The positivity rate in the city was lowest on March 2 at 0.69, the same day Bengaluru also recorded the lowest number of new cases at 106 in the past seven days, the data shows.

181.title: Jadeja is becoming the genuine all-rounder we talk about: Gambhir
181.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 175-run innings during India's first innings in the ongoing Mohali Test, Gautam Gambhir said the 33-year-old is becoming a "genuine all-rounder". "The way Jadeja has contributed with the bat, whether it was England, Australia or now India, it's a great sign for Indian cricket," Gambhir stated. Jadeja has also picked 232 wickets in 57 Tests.

182.title: BSF seizes over 400 kg human hair being smuggled into Bangladesh in 1 yr
182.article_body: Border Security Force has seized more than 400 kilos of human hair while they were being smuggled into Bangladesh over the past one year. "First consignment, of around 12 kilos was intercepted in Nadia district in February 2021...At least 397 kilos of human hair were seized in 2021...while around 47 kilos have been seized so far...this year," BSF official said.

183.title: Countries with relations with India can urge PM Modi to ask Putin to stop war: Ukraine
183.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said that all the countries that enjoy special relations with India can appeal to PM Narendra Modi to continue reaching out to Russian President Vladimir Putin and explaining that this war is against the interest of all. He added, "Ordinary Indians can put pressure on Russian Embassy in India to stop the war."

184.title: Police find woman on Hyd road; call ambulance, arrange food; share pic
184.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share picture of a woman. Police said woman was found on Chintalakunta road and was suffering from stomach pain. The post by police also said that ambulance was called, after which, the woman's health was checked. Food was also arranged for her. "Shifted her to Aleti Ashramam. She is speaking different languages," police wrote.

185.title: Mumbai man jailed for removing shirt, making lewd gestures before women police
185.article_body: A magistrate court has sentenced a man to ten days in jail and imposed a fine of ₹500 for removing his shirt and making lewd gestures before women police personnel at Mumbai's Dadar police station in 2016. The man was among two persons who were taken to the police station as the duo was shouting and fighting under Keshavsut flyover.

186.title: Hyd man climbs electric pole after cart gets stolen, police share video
186.article_body: A vendor whose pushcart was allegedly stolen climbed an electric pole in Hyderabad's Amberpet on Saturday. The man alleged someone had stolen his cart and demanded for it to be returned to him or he would end his life. Reports said local residents informed police about the incident. The police promised him justice, after which he stepped down from pole.

187.title: Was crying for 40 days after giving birth: Mandira on postpartum depression
187.article_body: Actress Mandira Bedi said she was crying for first 40 days after giving birth. "I could not understand. Your hormones have taken toss. You have taken human being out of you. So, that's what postpartum depression is. It's hormonal imbalance," she said, adding, "On 41st day in the pouring rain, I went to exercise...I was miraculously feeling much better emotionally."

188.title: 62-yr-old retired Army man jumps off 18th-floor balcony in Gurugram, dies
188.article_body: A 62-year-old retired Army man allegedly died by suicide after jumping off the 18th-floor balcony of his daughter's apartment in Gurugram on Saturday, police said. The man, a resident of Delhi, had reportedly come to his daughter's apartment around five days ago with his wife. His family claimed he was mentally disturbed, police said, adding that they're investigating the case.

189.title: Data-stealing 'TeaBot' malware found in Google Play: Researchers
189.article_body: An Android malware called 'TeaBot', designed to steal user data like passwords and text messages, was found in Google Play and downloaded thousands of times, researchers at Cleafy said. They noted that the malicious 'QR Code & Barcode – Scanner' app appeared legitimate and well-functioning. However, it was acting as a dropper to deliver 'TeaBot' through a fake in-app update.

190.title: India to bat first against Pakistan in 2022 Women's World Cup, playing XI announced
190.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj won the toss and elected to bat first against Pakistan in their first 2022 Women's World Cup match at Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma will open for India. India's playing XI also includes Pooja Vastrakar, Meghna Singh and Rajeshwari Gayakwad. India have never lost against Pakistan in Women's World Cup history.

191.title: Israeli PM meets Putin in Moscow to discuss Russia-Ukraine conflict
191.article_body: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on Saturday to discuss the conflict in Ukraine, an official Israeli statement said. "The meeting lasted for about two and a half hours," it added. Notably, Israel, a close ally of the United States, has condemned the Russian invasion and sent humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

192.title: Nawab Malik being linked to Dawood as he's muslim: Sharad Pawar
192.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's arrest in an alleged money laundering case was "politically motivated". He added that Malik was being linked to the underworld don Dawood Ibrahim "because he's a Muslim". Dismissing BJP's demands for Malik's resignation, Pawar said, "PM Modi should explain why Narayan Rane didn't resign when he was arrested".

193.title: Kamala Harris to visit Romania, Poland amid Ukraine-Russia conflict
193.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris will visit Poland and Romania from March 9 to 11 amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Harris' "meetings will...focus on how the US can further support Ukraine's neighbours as they welcome and care for refugees fleeing violence", her office said. Notably, Harris had visited Europe last month to attend the Munich Security Conference.

194.title: G7 foreign ministers condemn Russian attack on Ukrainian civilians
194.article_body: G7 foreign ministers on Friday said they were "deeply concerned with the catastrophic humanitarian toll taken by Russia's continuing strikes" against Ukrainian civilians. "We re-emphasize that indiscriminate attacks are prohibited by international humanitarian law. We will hold accountable those responsible for war crimes, including indiscriminate use of weapons against civilians," they added.

195.title: He brought such joy to the game: Mick Jagger on Shane Warne
195.article_body: Mick Jagger, vocalist of the English rock band The Rolling Stones, condoled the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, saying, "I'm so saddened by the sudden death of Shane Warne. He brought such joy to the game and was the greatest spin bowler ever." Warne died aged 52 on Friday of a suspected heart attack in Thailand.

196.title: Thousands of Ladakhis protest attack on Shia mosque in Pakistan
196.article_body: Thousands of people took part in a protest in Ladakh's Kargil on Saturday against the bombing of a Shia mosque in Pakistan. Raising slogans against Pakistan over its alleged failure in protecting the minorities, the protesters marched through the Shia-dominated main town and later staged a sit-in. Around 62 worshippers had died in the blast.

197.title: Khattar launches portal for giving monetary help on medical grounds
197.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday launched a portal for those seeking financial assistance on medical grounds under the Chief Minister's Relief Fund. Khattar said that after re-examining the earlier process, directions were given to digitise it through the SARAL portal. The amount shall be transferred directly to the account of the applicant or beneficiary.

198.title: We had posters of him on the wall: Pat Cummins on Shane Warne
198.article_body: Reacting to Shane Warne's demise, Pat Cummins said, "He was an all-time great and a once-in-a-century kind cricketer. His records will live on forever." Cummins added, "We had posters of him on the wall. We love...his showmanship, his charisma, his tactics, the way he helped Australia win so many games and above everything else he was an incredibly skilled leg-spinner."

199.title: CCI dismisses predatory pricing claims against e-commerce firm Shopee
199.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has dismissed allegations of predatory pricing levelled against the e-commerce platform Shopee. In its order, CCI said that Shopee did not hold a significant market power as it is a new entrant. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) had claimed that Shopee sold various products at low prices and indulged in predatory pricing.

200.title: Federer unlikely to play Wimbledon says coach Severin Luthi: Reports
200.article_body: Roger Federer's coach Severin Luthi reportedly said it is unlikely the 20-time Grand Slam champion will play this year's Wimbledon as he continues to recover from knee surgery. "I'm not someone who is saying it's impossible. But I can't imagine it right now," Luthi said. Federer, 40, announced last year he will undergo his third knee surgery in two years.

201.title: BJP dissolves 8 district units in Tamil Nadu
201.article_body: The BJP on Saturday dissolved eight district units in Tamil Nadu as part of its efforts to strengthen the party organisation. BJP's Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai also named eight interim office-bearers to oversee party work in these districts. Party spokesperson Narayanan Thirupathy said the move was not related to performance of BJP functionaries in recently concluded urban civic polls.

202.title: Advanced Brahmos missile shows pin-point destruction of target, video released
202.article_body: The Indian Navy on Saturday successfully test-fired an advanced version of the BrahMos cruise missile with long-range precision strike capability. "Pin-point destruction of target demonstrated combat and mission readiness of frontline platforms," said the Indian Navy, sharing a video of the test. "Yet another shot in the arm for Aatmanirbhar Bharat," said the Navy.

203.title: 97-yr-old Stanislavskyi, world's oldest tennis player, to stay in Ukraine amid war
203.article_body: Leonid Stanislavskyi, who holds the Guinness World Record for being the world's oldest tennis player, said he'll stay in Ukraine despite the ongoing war with Russia. "I hope I live to reach 100. I have to survive this frightening situation," the 97-year-old said. "I'm hoping that the war will end and I will be able to play tennis," he added.

204.title: Russia, Belarus suspended from Council of Baltic Sea States: EU
204.article_body: The European Union on Saturday said it joined other members of the Council of the Baltic Sea States (CBSS) in suspending Russia and Belarus from its activities. "This decision is a part of the European Union's and like-minded partners response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the involvement of Belarus in this unprovoked and unjustified aggression," it said.

205.title: Get your petrol tanks full, election offer on fuel ending: Rahul
205.article_body: Ahead of the final phase of polling in Uttar Pradesh, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday criticised the Centre over rising fuel prices. "Get your petrol tanks full immediately. (PM Narendra) Modi-led government's 'election' offer is going to end," he tweeted. Earlier on Friday, Rahul had accused the BJP of seeking votes on the "basis of lies".

206.title: 19-year-old woman hangs self in Punjab's Mohali, friend booked
206.article_body: A 19-year-old woman hanged herself at her house at Amb Sahib Colony in Punjab's Mohali on Friday. Her friend Vishal has been booked for abetment to suicide. The victim's mother said her daughter had been upset after falling out with Vishal. "The body has been kept at the Phase-6 Civil Hospital for autopsy," said Gagandeep Singh, SHO, Phase 11, Mohali.

207.title: Russian air, artillery strikes in Ukraine lessen in past 24 hours: UK
207.article_body: British defence ministry on Saturday said the rate of Russian air and artillery strikes was lower in past 24 hours as compared to the previous days. "Ukraine continues to hold the key cities of Kharkiv, Chernihiv and Mariupol," added the ministry. The intelligence update by British officials also stated Russian forces were probably advancing towards southern port city of Mykolaiv.

208.title: Indian doctor stays behind in Ukraine to help students, says 'I'm not stuck here'
208.article_body: A 37-year-old doctor and student consultant from Kolkata, Dr Prithwi Raj Ghosh, has decided not to leave Ukraine and stay behind to help in the evacuation of Indian students. "I am not stuck here in Kyiv, I am not leaving by choice. I have evacuated almost 350 students from Ukraine. They were my students in Kyiv," he told India Today.

209.title: Jadeja clarifies India declaring with him on 175*, says 'I sent a message to Rohit'
209.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has clarified India declaring at 574/8 with him on 175*, saying, "I sent a message [to Rohit Sharma] that there is something on offer from...pitch." He added, "I suggested we should put Sri Lanka in to bat [at that time]." He further said, "The plan was to declare quickly and exploit the fatigue of the opposition batters."

210.title: Attack on nuclear power plant is a war crime: US Embassy in Ukraine
210.article_body: The US Embassy in Ukraine said attacking a nuclear power plant is a war crime following Russia's attack and seizure of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "It is a war crime to attack a nuclear power plant. Putin's shelling of Europe's largest nuclear plant takes his reign of terror one step further," the embassy said.

211.title: Turkey’s President Erdogan to speak with Russia's Putin: Spokesman
211.article_body: Spokesman Ibrahim Kalin on Saturday said Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan will speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday to discuss Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We are focusing on what steps we can take here to bring the sides to the negotiating table and to convince the Russian side (to stop)," Kalin said.

212.title: Srinagar's Jamia Masjid opens for public after 30 weeks
212.article_body: Thousands of devotees turned up to offer Friday prayers at the Jamia Masjid in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar as it opened for public after a gap of 30 weeks. The mosque had closed last April due to the COVID-19 pandemic. "We pray to Almighty that this place should always remain open," said Mehraj ud din, a local resident.

213.title: Russia arrests US' Olympic basketball champion, says she had 'vapes' in luggage
213.article_body: Russia on Saturday said it has arrested US' two-time Olympic basketball champion Brittney Griner on narcotics charges. Russian Federal Customs Service said that an inspection of her hand luggage after she arrived on a flight from US in February "confirmed the presence of 'vapes' (and) a liquid with a specific smell". USA Basketball said they're closely monitoring the legal situation.

214.title: Britain urges citizens to leave Russia following invasion of Ukraine
214.article_body: Britain on Saturday urged its citizens to leave Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. "If your presence in Russia is not essential, we strongly advise that you consider leaving by remaining commercial routes," the British Foreign Office said. It added that flying directly may not be possible, but said flights via Turkey and the Middle East were available.

215.title: Man who jumped parole 35 yrs ago arrested from his home in Gujarat
215.article_body: A murder convict, who was allegedly on the run for 35 years after jumping parole, was arrested by the Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS) on Saturday. An ATS official said they deployed a team outside Devendra Dhanani's Rajkot residence after receiving a tip-off that he had returned during the pandemic. Dhanani was arrested along with his brother in 1984.

216.title: Russia vows to impose tough sanctions against UK interests in Russia
216.article_body: Russian foreign ministry on Thursday vowed to impose tough but proportionate measures that would "undoubtedly undermine" British interests in Russia. Russian government said Britain chose to move towards an open confrontation with Russia leaving it with no choice but to enforce stringent measures. UK PM imposed the largest-ever sanctions against Russia following invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

217.title: New US Ambassador reaches Beijing amid tense US-China relations
217.article_body: The US embassy on Saturday said the new US Ambassador Nicholas Burns on Friday reached Beijing, amid tense relations between US and China over Taiwan, human rights and the war in Ukraine. Relations remain tense following the US-led diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics in protest over human rights violations and China's diplomatic support of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

218.title: BJP will bring better-than-expected results in Punjab: JP Nadda
218.article_body: BJP president JP Nadda, on Saturday, while speaking about the party's performance in Punjab, said they received a very positive response from the people. Nadda, who was addressing a joint press conference with Home Minister Amit Shah, added that the party had for the first time fought on over 65 seats in the state and "will bring better-than-expected results there".

219.title: State govt gave 5 lakh jobs to youth in 5 years in UP: CM Yogi
219.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath, while addressing a rally in UP's Sonbhadra on Saturday, said his government provided 5 lakh jobs in the last five years. He added that their policies also created self-employment opportunities for around two crore youngsters in the state. He earlier said his government was planning to provide employment to at least one member of each family.

220.title: Record tourist footfall in J&K, stone-pelting reduced: Army
220.article_body: The Indian Army's Chinar Corps on Saturday said that there has been a reduction in incidents of stone-pelting, protests and bandhs in Jammu & Kashmir, adding that the number of tourists has also increased. "A record number of tourists came here last year," Lieutenant General DP Pandey said. He also stated that terrorist recruitments had also come down in J&K.

221.title: Hong Kong mortuaries deploy mobile fridges amid surge in COVID deaths
221.article_body: Mortuaries in Hong Kong have deployed mobile refrigeration units to store bodies amid a surge in COVID-19 deaths in the city. Hong Kong had a capacity to store 1,350 bodies at the start of March, according to a Bloomberg report. The Department of Health is working to boost the capacity to store 300 more bodies, the report said.

222.title: 3 students on motorcycle killed after truck runs them over in MP
222.article_body: Three students were killed after a speeding truck, coming from the opposite direction, collided with their motorcycle and ran over them in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district on Saturday, police said. The truck driver has been arrested and his vehicle impounded, police added. The victims were returning home after appearing for their class 10 exams at the time of the incident.

223.title: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is the craziest film I've ever done: Taika
223.article_body: Filmmaker-actor Taika Waititi has said that he has done crazy sh*t in his life but 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is the craziest film he's ever done. Taika further said, "If you wrote down all the elements of this film, it shouldn't make sense. It's almost like it shouldn't be made...I mean, you'd never work again. Maybe I won't after this."

224.title: MLA suspended from Guj Assembly for 1 week over unparliamentary word
224.article_body: Congress MLA Punja Vansh was on Friday suspended from the Gujarat Assembly for seven days for allegedly using an unparliamentary word in the House. The Congress legislators staged a walkout from the Assembly over his suspension. "When the member has expressed regret over his words, such proposals should be withdrawn," said Shailesh Parmar, Deputy Leader of the Opposition.

225.title: Dynasts want to serve self-interests: PM on Opp'n amid Ukraine war
225.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said dynasts were looking to serve their self-interests over the Ukraine crisis. "If India's security forces...deal with a crisis, Opposition parties do everything to make the situation more critical," PM Modi said at an election rally in Uttar Pradesh. "We saw this during the pandemic and today during the Ukraine crisis," he added.

226.title: Ukrainian crowd hides under a damaged bridge, pic goes viral
226.article_body: A picture featuring a crowd gathered under a damaged bridge in Ukraine is being widely circulated on social media. The National Guard of Ukraine while tweeting the picture, wrote, "Tragic photo of the day...Hundreds of Ukrainians are hiding under the ruins of the bridge from the strikes of the Russian fascists' aircraft and artillery."

227.title: Pic of Taliban's Sirajuddin Haqqani, FBI's most wanted terrorist, released for 1st time
227.article_body: The Taliban has for the first time put out a picture of its interior minister, Sirajuddin Haqqani, who is among FBI's most wanted terrorists. The picture was tweeted by Zabihullah Mujahid, spokesperson of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. The US Department of State is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information leading directly to his arrest.

228.title: Change MCI rules to open more medical colleges: Gehlot to Centre
228.article_body: Talking about the Ukraine crisis, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Saturday suggested changing rules of Medical Council of India (MCI) to open more colleges in the country. "Both government and private sectors should be allowed to open more...medical colleges," he added. The scheme to open one medical college in each district is not enough due to increasing population, Gehlot said.

229.title: BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi's son joins Samajwadi Party
229.article_body: Mayank Joshi, son of BJP MP from Prayagraj Rita Bahuguna Joshi, joined the Samajwadi Party (SP) on Saturday, hours before the campaign ended for the final phase of the UP Assembly polls. Joshi joined the SP during an election rally in Azamgarh. Notably, Rita Bahuguna Joshi declined to comment on the development and said that she'll remain in the BJP.

230.title: Psychologist said ex-NSE CEO Chitra was evasive during probe: CBI
230.article_body: During the hearing of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application in connection with co-location case, the CBI said a senior forensic psychologist was roped in to extract facts from Ramkrishna. "The...psychologist...observed that [Ramkrishna] was evasive in her responses. She always attributed knowledge regarding matters to her lower functionaries," the CBI told the court.

231.title: Western sanctions on Russia are akin to declaration of war: Putin
231.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that Western sanctions on Russia over the invasion of Ukraine, "are akin to a declaration of war", adding, "But thank God it has not come to that." Putin reiterated that he aims to defend Russian speaking communities in Ukraine through the "demilitarisation and de-Nazification" of the country so that it becomes neutral.

232.title: Madhya Pradesh govt increases DA for state govt employees to 31%
232.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to increase the dearness allowance for state government employees to 31%, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Saturday. The payment for the same will start from April 2022. He further announced that the state government will also give an additional ₹25,000 to girl students under the "Ladli Laxmi scheme" on taking admission in the college.

233.title: Russian billionaires' luxury yachts, villas worth $156 million seized by Italy
233.article_body: Italian authorities have seized luxury yachts and villas worth $156 million from sanctioned Russian billionaires since Friday. Italy has impounded yachts belonging to Russia's richest man, Alexei Mordashov and Gennady Timchenko, a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Further, reports said villas owned by billionaire Alisher Usmanov and state TV host Vladimir Soloviev were also seized.

234.title: Two Kerala nurses chosen for best COVID-19 vaccinators' award
234.article_body: Two nurses from Kerala have been selected for the best vaccinators' award as part of the national COVID-19 vaccination programme. They will be honoured in Delhi on March 8 on the occasion of International Women's Day. "Priya...and T Bhavani...have been selected as the best vaccinators from Kerala," Kerala Health Minister Veena George said.

235.title: Singapore announces sanctions against Russia over invasion of Ukraine
235.article_body: Singapore on Saturday announced sanctions against four Russian banks and an export ban on electronics, computers and military items in response to unprovoked Russian attack on Ukraine. The measures prohibit Singapore's institutions to enter into any transactions with the sanctioned banks. The institutions are also banned from providing services facilitating fundraising for Russian government.

236.title: Death toll among Ukrainian civilians due to conflict rises to 351
236.article_body: The United Nations (UN) on Saturday said that at least 351 Ukrainian civilians have been killed in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine on February 24. Around 707 people have been injured in the conflict, it added. "The real figures are considerably higher, especially in Government-controlled territory and especially in recent days," it further said.

237.title: Ex-Punjab minister booked for assaulting man on polling day
237.article_body: Former Punjab minister and BJP leader Rana Gurmit Singh Sodhi along with six others were booked on Friday on assault and intimidation charges. According to the FIR, a man, identified as Surjit Singh, was allegedly thrashed by Rana Gurmit and others on polling day in Ferozepur. Meanwhile, a counter-complaint has also been filed by Rana Gurmit against Surjit.

238.title: Gujarat IFS officer suspended for alleged financial irregularities
238.article_body: The Gujarat government has ordered immediate suspension of IFS officer KS Randhawa for alleged financial irregularities during his tenure as Managing Director of Gujarat Agro Industries Corporation. "His inefficiency in implementation of Comprehensive Agriculture Business Policy resulted in...liability of ₹540 crore at the end of scheme," an order by state Forest and Environment Department said.

239.title: US Secy of State Blinken visits Poland amid Russia-Ukraine war
239.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Poland on Saturday amid Russia-Ukraine war. Blinken met Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki and discussed stepping up sanctions on Russia. "My visit to Poland has come at one of the most urgent moments in the long history between our two countries," said Blinken. He also met Polish Foreign Minister Zbigniew Rau.

240.title: PM chairs another high-level meeting on Ukraine war, evacuation of students
240.article_body: PM Narendra Modi held another high-level meeting on Saturday to discuss the situation in war-hit Ukraine as well as the evacuation of Indian students stranded there. The meeting was attended by Union Ministers including External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar as well as Foreign Secretary HV Shringla. Over 600 Indian students are stranded in Ukraine's Sumy, the government said earlier.

241.title: Video shows moment when part of glacier collapses & re-emerges in Argentina
241.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed the moment a large portion of a glacier in Argentina collapsed and then re-emerged from underneath the water. The video was captured by a group of tourists visiting the Perito Moreno Glacier. The process when intact chunks of ice from a glacier break off and flow into the water is known as calving.

242.title: Designer Prasad Bidapa's son sends obscene messages to pregnant actress, arrested
242.article_body: Adam Bidapa, son of fashion designer Prasad Bidapa, was on Friday arrested for allegedly sending obscene messages to a Kannada film actress. "He was completely drunk and out of his senses...when he sent me those messages...They are abusive, brutal, disgusting, cheap," she said. "I'm seven months pregnant. I'm refraining from indulging in anything that causes negative energy," she added.

243.title: Ukraine shares pic of captured Russian pilot after shooting down aircraft
243.article_body: Ukraine has shared a video of a Russian pilot who was captured after his aircraft was shot down by Ukrainian forces. It also shared his picture with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. "The video shows a downed Russian pilot, one of Putin's "aces", who was honoured with an audience with Bashar al-Assad for his atrocities in Syria," Ukrainian Security Services wrote.

244.title: Special screening of The Kashmir Files organised for politicians, Army
244.article_body: The makers of Vivek Agnihotri directorial 'The Kashmir Files' organised a special screening of the film for politicians, Army officials and Kashmiri Pandits in Jammu a week ahead of its release. The film is based on interviews of the first generation victims of the genocide of the Kashmiri Pandit community which led to their mass exodus from the state.

245.title: Most difficult part of jail was passing time: Munawar Faruqui
245.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, who is a contestant on reality television show 'Lock Upp', has said that the most difficult part of being in jail was passing time. He recalled that he used to walk inside the jail to pass time but the barrack was so small and crowded that he had to be extra careful not to push other prisoners.

246.title: Ukraine's attempts to involve NATO in conflict affecting talks: Russia
246.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's attempt to secure direct NATO help in conflict between Russia and Ukraine wasn't helping talks between the two sides, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said. "Constant angry statements from...Zelenskyy do not increase optimism," he added. Notably, Lavrov's statement comes after NATO turned down Zelenskyy's appeal to create a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

247.title: All Indians in Ukraine's Pisochyn and Kharkiv evacuated
247.article_body: All Indians have been evacuated from Ukraine's Pisochyn, the Indian embassy in Ukraine said on Saturday. The Ministry of External Affairs' spokesperson Arindam Bagchi earlier said that no Indian has been left in Kharkiv. "The main focus is on Sumy now," said Bagchi, adding that there are over 600 Indian students stuck there.

248.title: I'm impressed, moved by Zelenskyy; terrified for Ukraine: Sean Penn
248.article_body: Hollywood actor Sean Penn has said that he was endlessly impressed and moved by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He further said that he is terrified for him and for Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. Sean had earlier shared a picture of escaping Ukraine on foot. "This is an extraordinary moment. The way he has unified that country," the actor added.

249.title: Peaceful polls in Uttar Pradesh surprised Opposition: CM Yogi
249.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said the peaceful conduct of six phases of UP Assembly elections has been a surprise for the Opposition. Yogi said that maintaining law and order in UP has been the biggest achievement of BJP government. Notably, campaigning for the seventh and final phase of UP polls came to an end on Saturday.

250.title: Rohit sends Kohli back, asks him to re-enter field for guard of honour, video goes viral
250.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India captain Rohit Sharma sending Virat Kohli back and asking him to re-enter the field before giving him a guard of honour during second day of first Test against Sri Lanka. Kohli was given the guard of honour by his teammates to mark his 100th Test. Kohli scored 45 runs in the first innings.

251.title: Woman declared dead by doctors found alive just before post-mortem in MP
251.article_body: A 32-year-old woman, who was declared dead by doctors, was found alive, just before her post-mortem in Madhya Pradesh. The woman's brother reportedly saw movement in her body and later informed doctors, following which she was found alive and admitted to the hospital. The doctors had also issued a death certificate of the woman, who got injured in an accident.

252.title: I was bullied online, caused me grief: Dua Lipa on viral hip step
252.article_body: Singer Dua Lipa has revealed that she was bullied online for her viral dance step in 2017, saying, "It actually caused me a lot of grief." The step was of her moving her hips back and forth standing virtually still. "The reason we're talking about it is because I've brought it back, I'm doing it on my tour," Dua added.

253.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz youngest to represent Spain in Davis Cup since Nadal in 2004
253.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz on Friday became the youngest player to represent Spain at the Davis Cup since world number four Rafael Nadal in 2004. Alcaraz, 18, beat Marius Copil in straight sets to win his Davis Cup debut match to give Spain a 2-0 lead over Romania in their qualifying match. Nadal was 17 when he made his Davis Cup debut.

254.title: Difficult to put any blame on his shoulders: Schmeichel on Ronaldo
254.article_body: Former Manchester United goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel said that he feels Cristiano Ronaldo's teammates are to blame for his poor form at Manchester United. "He's trying and trying to build up the other players. When you're at the games...you can see how much he's trying to help everyone," he said. Ronaldo has scored once in his last ten games.

255.title: Towing of vehicles in Mumbai to stop on trial basis: Police chief
255.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday took to Twitter to seek citizens' opinions on ending vehicle towing practice by traffic police. He wrote, "As a first, we plan to stop towing of vehicles. Experimental to start with...final if you comply. Let me know what you think." He further added that the discussion doesn't reflect official position on the issue.

256.title: India lost nearly 20% species in 20 years: Zoological Survey head
256.article_body: Zoological Survey of India Director Dhriti Banerjee on Thursday said around one-fifth of species in an earmarked geographical location in the country have vanished in last 20 years. Banerjee added upto 150 species a day and 18,000 to 55,000 species a year get extinct worldwide due to human activities. Meanwhile, ZSI recently flagged several fish and turtle species as endangered.

257.title: Box of human heads stolen from medical truck in US
257.article_body: A box of human heads and a dolly have been stolen from a medical truck in US' Denver, according to authorities. Police said the incident took place on Thursday, when someone broke into the truck which was carrying human remains for use in medical research. While no arrest has been made yet, investigation in the case is underway.

258.title: War with Ukraine to have consequences for whole world including Russia-India ties: Russia
258.article_body: Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov has said, "Russia-Ukraine crisis will have consequences for the whole world, including Russia-India ties. To what extent, it'll be reflected, can't say now." "There may be an impact in terms of transactions, possibility of financial cooperation in connection with sanctions," he added. This comes as US and many other countries imposed sanctions on Russia.

259.title: Ratan Tata always keeps his promises: 28-yr-old assistant lists 2 of Tata's values
259.article_body: Shantanu Naidu, the 28-year-old assistant of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, in an interview revealed two values that he had observed in the latter. Naidu said, "He will just help so many people each day and then totally forget about it." He added that Ratan Tata always keeps his promises and "always delivers when he has given his word."

260.title: Dating Kanye was 'a crash course on how to be famous': Julia Fox
260.article_body: Actress Julia Fox has stated that her relationship with rapper Kanye West was like "a crash course on how to be famous". She further said that it felt like she was being cast in the role of his girlfriend and Kanye was casting her. "He was the orchestrator of it all. It really did feel like a movie," Julia added.

261.title: Countries imposing no-fly zone over Ukraine would be parties to conflict: Putin
261.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that any country that sought to impose no-fly zone over Ukraine would be considered by Moscow to have entered an armed conflict. He added that it would have "colossal and catastrophic consequences not only for Europe but also the whole world". Putin also dismissed rumours that Russia is planning to declare martial law.

262.title: We're too big to be isolated: Russia on sanctions over Ukraine war
262.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Saturday termed western nations' sanctions on Russia "economic banditry", adding, "This does not mean Russia is isolated." He added, "The world is too big for Europe and America to isolate a country and even more so a country as big as Russia." He said that US' sanctions on Russia's energy exports would jolt energy markets.

263.title: Australia's King taps armband after taking wicket in Women's WC, pays tribute to Warne
263.article_body: Australia leg-spinner Alana King clean bowled England's Sophia Dunkley in their 2022 Women's World Cup match with a sharp turning delivery and then paid tribute to Australian spin legend Shane Warne by tapping her black armband. Australia's players were wearing two black armbands each in honour of Rod Marsh and Shane Warne, who both passed away this week.

264.title: Nearly 10,000 Russian soldiers killed in 10 days: Ukraine
264.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Saturday claimed nearly 10,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. The ministry added 269 tanks, 39 aircraft and 40 helicopters were destroyed including the Sukhoi Su-25 attack aircraft. Out of the 10,000 killed troops, over 5,400 were killed till March 2, reported the ministry.

265.title: Warne's ex-fiancée Elizabeth Hurley shares pics with him, says 'RIP beloved Lionheart'
265.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's ex-fiancée, British actress Elizabeth Hurley took to social media to mourn his demise. Sharing pictures with him, she wrote, "I feel like the sun has gone behind a cloud forever. RIP my beloved Lionheart." They got engaged in 2011 and split in 2013, but remained friends.

266.title: Kanye shares post on divorce after legal separation from Kim
266.article_body: Rapper Kanye West took to Instagram to share a post which compares divorce to getting 'full-blown COVID-19', 'being set on fire' and 'walking on glass' among other things. This comes after a court in Los Angeles declared his ex-wife Kim Kardashian legally single and she dropped the surname 'West' from her name on all social media platforms.

267.title: SpaceX launches 47 Starlink satellites in its 9th launch this year
267.article_body: Elon Musk's private space venture, SpaceX launched 47 Starlink satellites on Thursday as part of its ninth launch this year. The newly-launched satellites have joined over 2,000 others, all deployed to create first-generation constellation orbiting Earth. As per SpaceX, the constellation will act as a space-based broadband internet service aimed at providing internet connectivity across the globe.

268.title: Indian artist creates sand art asking to stop Russia-Ukraine war; pic viral
268.article_body: Indian sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has appealed for peace through his sand art amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. The art shows Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the backdrop of their respective flags with the text "STOP WAR". The middle section shows a child standing on burning ashes with both arms stretched out on either side.

269.title: China announces military drills in South China Sea near Vietnam coast
269.article_body: Chinese government announced military exercises starting from Friday till March 15 in South China Sea in an area between China's Hainan province and Vietnam's Hue. While China claims a large part of the area and has built artificial islands and airfields there, Vietnam had accused China of infringement on its sovereignty as a part of waterway lies within its control.

270.title: Actor Mahesh Babu launches foundation to help kids at Hyd hospital
270.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu visited Hyderabad's Rainbow Children's Heart Institute on Saturday to launch Pure Little Hearts Foundation. As part of the initiative, the Mahesh Babu Foundation will help treat economically-challenged children with congenital heart diseases. "Children have always been close to my heart...I'm happy to support children who need cardiac care at RCHI," the actor said.

271.title: Towing of vehicles in Mumbai to stop on trial basis: Police chief
271.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday took to Twitter to seek citizens' opinions on ending vehicle towing practice by traffic police. He wrote, "As a first, we plan to stop towing of vehicles. Experimental to start with...final if you comply. Let me know what you think." He further added that the discussion doesn't reflect official position on the issue.

272.title: Sikkim govt to provide ₹20,000 each to all non-working mothers: CM
272.article_body: Sikkim CM PS Tamang on Friday said that the state government will give ₹20,000 each to all non-working mothers annually under 'Aama' scheme. Only those whose names are in the electoral roll will get the money, he added. The government will also provide free sanitary napkins to girls studying in Class 9 and above under 'Bahini' scheme, he further said.

273.title: UP man kills mother after his share of money given to sister-in-law
273.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his mother and injuring his father in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr. During an investigation, the accused reportedly revealed that his father had sold an ancestral land for ₹12 lakh and distributed the money among his brothers. However, his father gave his share of money to his sister-in-law, following which he killed his mother.

274.title: Biggest advice I got from Elon on crypto is 'be cautious': Musk's brother
274.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk told Input Magazine the biggest advice he got from Elon regarding cryptocurrencies is "be cautious". Kimbal said he doesn't even know what the Tesla CEO's views are on cryptocurrencies. Kimbal earlier said Tesla was ignorant of the environmental impact of cryptocurrencies when it purchased Bitcoin and started accepting it for car purchases.

275.title: Man wanted in 22 cyber fraud cases arrested by Hyd Police in Bihar
275.article_body: A 37-year-old man, involved in 22 cyber fraud cases in Telangana, was arrested in Bihar by Hyderabad Police on Friday. The accused, Rajesh Mahato, offered gifts and lotteries through e-commerce portals before collecting money for claiming them, police said. One of the victims, a woman from Tirumalgiri, was duped of ₹28 lakh by Mahato and his accomplices, police added.

276.title: Video shows Indian students collecting and melting snow for water in Ukraine
276.article_body: A video showing Indian students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy collecting and melting snow for basic water needs has surfaced online. In the video, a student tells that they have to walk for around 2km amid shelling to get drinking water. In another clip, a group of students tell that they don't even have drinking water available with them.

277.title: Ukrainian woman married to Indian man seeks PM Modi's help, says 'My family is there'
277.article_body: Amid tensions between Ukraine and Russia, a Ukrainian woman who is married to a Kashmiri man has reached out to PM Narendra Modi to help Ukraine "in any which way possible". "My heart cries because my family is there...They're peaceful people," said Oliza. "Today, our country is fighting for democracy and peace. They have independence in their heart," she added.

278.title: Man cheats victim of ₹1 lakh at ATM kiosk in Hyderabad, arrested
278.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly defrauding a man who came to deposit money at an ATM kiosk. The accused, Rama Rao, convinced the victim to lend him ₹1 lakh cash saying he'd return it, police said. The victim had also received a message indicating money transfer to his account, but later realised he was duped.

279.title: Hundreds book Airbnbs in Ukraine to send money to citizens amid war
279.article_body: Hundreds of people are booking Airbnb rentals in Ukraine to offer monetary assistance to local families affected by war. This came after US-based influencer Tommy Marcus proposed the idea of paying for Ukrainian Airbnbs to financially support their hosts. Marcus shared some replies from Ukrainian hosts, one of which said, "Hope we'll win and stop this horror."

280.title: I'm not getting what I want on TV: Comedian Ali Asgar
280.article_body: Comedian-actor Ali Asgar in an interview has stated that he is not getting the kind of offers on television like he wants, adding that he said no to a few cameos. "When a show gets shut, the actors are blamed...Then the tag of hit and flop gets attached to you," he added. Ali further said that he wants to reinvent.

281.title: Charlize was finest lead: Tom after she criticised his 'bad behaviour'
281.article_body: Actor Tom Hardy has said that his 'Mad Max: Fury Road' co-star Charlize Theron laid down the finest lead character in an action movie and that credit is much deserved. This comes after Charlize criticised him saying she doesn't want to "make excuses for bad behaviour" but it was a tough shoot, adding that things "came to blows" between them.

282.title: Over 3 crore in 15-18 age group fully vaccinated: Health Minister
282.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Saturday said that more than three crore youngsters between the ages of 15 and 18 have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. "Young India is taking the world's largest vaccination drive to the next level!" he added. The vaccination drive for the age group had started on January 3.

283.title: Over 300 cyclists participate in Cyclothon event in Navi Mumbai
283.article_body: Over 300 cyclists participated in 'Cyclothon 2022' held at Navi Mumbai's Palm Beach Road on Saturday. The event was jointly organised by the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation and Cyclist Club of India to create awareness about environmental conservation. Several record-holders like Sai Patil, the youngest cyclist to cross the distance from Kashmir to Kanyakumari, were present at the event.

284.title: 9-yr-old UP girl returns home bleeding, says school principal raped her
284.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 71-year-old school principal on Wednesday in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district. The incident came to light when the girl, who's a student of Class 3, returned home bleeding and narrated her ordeal to her parents, a report stated. Meanwhile, police have arrested the principal and a teacher for hiding details of the crime.

285.title: Govt yet to submit emissions targets 4 months after 'net-zero' vow
285.article_body: Centre has not yet submitted its targets for cutting greenhouse gas emissions, four months after PM Narendra Modi announced India would stop greenhouse emissions by 2070. "We don't have time anymore" to wait for all.. to start reducing emissions, said Niklas Höhne, a scientist tracking emission pledges. He urged government to come up with specified targets achievable with country's resources.

286.title: Fashion brands H&M, Zara & Mango shut outlets in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
286.article_body: Zara owner, Inditex has announced that it will close its shops in Russia and also halt online sales over the country’s invasion of Ukraine. Inditex has 502 stores in Russia, of which 86 are Zara outlets. This comes after fashion retailers Mango and H&M also closed their respective shops in Russia owing to the same reason.

287.title: Rohit offers India's Got Talent contestants to compose Cirkus theme
287.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty, who appeared as a guest judge on 'India's Got Talent', offered contestants Divyansh and Manuraj an offer to compose the theme of his upcoming film 'Cirkus'. Rohit added that rapper Badshah, who is a judge on the show, has composed some of the songs for the film. The filmmaker also urged Badshah to work with the duo.

288.title: Pune Metro work incomplete but PM will inaugurate it: NCP chief
288.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said that the work of the Metro service to be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi in Pune on Sunday is incomplete. He made the comment on the eve of PM Modi's visit to Pune. Pawar also said that the Centre needs to focus more on rescuing Indian students stranded in war-hit Ukraine.

289.title: US, Germany, Netherlands to send more weapons, troops: Lithuania
289.article_body: Lithuanian Defence Minister Arvydas Anušauskas on Saturday said Germany, US and Netherlands will send air defence systems, battalion armed with tanks and troops to Lithuania respectively. This comes in addition to troops which will visit Lithuania for military exercises this month. Lithuania which shares borders with Belarus, Russia asked NATO for more troops after Russian invasion of Ukraine.

290.title: Italian region offers to pay couples ₹1.6 lakh if they get married there
290.article_body: Italy's Lazio region is offering a refund of up to €2,000 (around ₹1.6 lakh) to couples who choose to host their wedding there, authorities said. Lazio is a central Italian region with Rome as its principal city. Authorities have set aside €10 million for the 'Lazio with love' initiative under which Italian and foreign couples are entitled to refunds.

291.title: Airport worker trolls Russia by waving Ukrainian flag to signal plane in Israel
291.article_body: An Israeli airport worker was seen waving the Ukrainian flag towards a Russian plane at Tel Aviv Airport. In a now-viral video, the unidentified man clad in a high-visibility vest of a ground crew is seen waving Ukraine's blue and yellow flag to signal a plane with a Russian flag outside its cockpit. The worker has reportedly been suspended.

292.title: Salman Khan to showcase art in first-ever solo show in Bengaluru
292.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will be showcasing his artwork in his first-ever solo show in Bengaluru's gallery g. The show titled 'Motherhood - An Artistic Ode to Mother Teresa' will be on display from March 11 to 20. Two of Salman's paintings, titled 'Still In Hope of Compassion' and 'Begging for Peace', will be on display on the GAC digital platform.

293.title: China to bring incentives to cut pollution, carbon emissions: Govt
293.article_body: Chinese government on Saturday said it will introduce new incentives to cut pollution and carbon emissions this year. China would "work harder" for cleaner, more efficient use of coal, said Premier Li Keqiang. He added government will increase the capacity of grids for power absorption by renewable sources. China has pledged to become carbon neutral by around 2060.

294.title: Manish Sisodia inaugurates Delhi's first-of-its-kind teachers' university
294.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has inaugurated the Delhi Teachers' University and said it's created to produce "nation builders". He said, "This is Delhi's first of its kind university that aims to prepare...highly qualified teachers. Government aims to inspire today's students to become tomorrow's teachers." It will offer a new age integrated teacher education programme like B.Ed after Class 12.

295.title: France plans to boost safety, security of Ukraine nuclear sites
295.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday said France will propose measures to boost safety, security of five main nuclear sites in Ukraine. The safeguards will be drawn up on the basis of International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) criteria, a statement by Macron added. This comes after a blaze broke out at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant following Russian shelling on Friday.

296.title: Russian man smashes his iPad after Apple stops selling products in Russia, video viral
296.article_body: Footage shows a Russian man smashing his iPad after Apple decided to stop selling its products in Russia amid invasion of Ukraine. He uses a hammer to smash it, also getting his son to deliver a few blows. "Here's our response to American sanctions! We don't fear you! We'll live without your nice 'pretty' things!" the man said.

297.title: UN probes alleged massacre that left dozens dead in Mali
297.article_body: The UN on Friday said it's investigating allegations that dozens of people were massacred in Mali. A video circulating on social media since Thursday shows dozens of badly-burned bodies with their eyes blindfolded and their hands bound together, according to Reuters. The bodies were found in an area where Islamist militants have been battling Malian soldiers, a local official said.

298.title: India record their highest Test total in Mohali, Sri Lanka end Day 2 at 108/4
298.article_body: India recorded their highest Test total in Mohali by declaring at 574/8 in their first innings in first Test against Sri Lanka. The visitors ended the second day at 108/4 with Ravichandran Ashwin taking two wickets. Ravindra Jadeja scored an unbeaten 175 in the first innings, registering the highest-ever Test score by an Indian batting at number seven.

299.title: Satyagraha will prove an unconquerable force: Mahindra on protests in Ukraine
299.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted a video of unarmed Ukrainians protesting against Russian troops in Kherson. Mahindra wrote, "When an army has to face unarmed civilians, they’re facing a weapon more powerful than tanks. Satyagraha will always prove an unconquerable force…Ask the British." In the clip, shots were also fired to disperse the crowd.

300.title: Inspired by YouTube video, 3 youngsters try to rob ATM kiosk in Delhi; held
300.article_body: Police arrested three people, including a 16-year-old juvenile for allegedly trying to rob an ATM kiosk inspired by a YouTube video in Outer Delhi's Nangloi area. The Axis Bank headquarters had informed police about some people carrying out suspicious activities at the kiosk on March 1. Police seized a drill machine, a hammer and a screw machine from their possession.

301.title: Govt panel recommends phase 3 trial of Sputnik Light COVID vaccine as booster dose
301.article_body: An expert panel of India's central drug authority has recommended the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) to give its nod for conducting phase-3 clinical trial of Sputnik Light as a booster dose. DCGI approved the single-dose COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in India subject to regulatory provisions on February 4. Sputnik Light vaccine has been approved in 29 countries.

302.title: India looking for tech to build electric mass rapid transportation: Gadkari
302.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said India is looking for a cost-effective technology to build mass rapid transportation system based on electricity. Addressing the Silicon Valley Dialogue, Gadkari added he has been approached by some American companies with the technology. Urging American companies to invest in India, he said both countries have a huge pool of young and talented engineers.

303.title: What are the major announcements made for B'luru in state Budget 2022-23?
303.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that ₹8,409 crore has been allocated for Bengaluru's development, including 1,000 crore for the Mekedatu project. He said that a skywalk will be constructed at Banashankari junction to connect the metro station with the bus stand. A mega jewellery park, 'Green Expo' and 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru.

304.title: Will Smith, Michael B Jordan to star in and produce 'I Am Legend' sequel
304.article_body: Actors Will Smith and Michael B Jordan will star in and produce the sequel of 2007 film 'I Am Legend'. This will be the first time that the actors will work together. According to Deadline, Oscar-winning Akiva Goldsman, who adapted Richard Matheson's 1954 novel for the 2007 film, will return to pen and produce the sequel.

305.title: Over 7.8 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
305.article_body: More than 7,87,300 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said. According to Polish Border Guards, a record 1,06,400 had entered the country from Ukraine on Friday alone. More than 12 lakh people have now fled Ukraine to escape war, the UN's International Organization for Migration said.

306.title: Warne will be remembered for what he did on, off the field: Labuschagne
306.article_body: Reacting to Australian spin legend Shane Warne's demise, Marnus Labuschagne tweeted Warne will be "forever remembered" for everything he did on and off the field. "Shocked and saddened at the news. Warne did so much for the game," added Labuschagne in his tweet. "The highlight of my...career was to keep wicket to Warne," read a tweet from Adam Gilchrist.

307.title: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth wishes Dhanush's brother on b'day, calls him 'father figure'
307.article_body: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to wish Dhanush's brother and director Selvaraghavan on his birthday. Sharing a picture of herself with Selvaraghavan, she wrote, "Happy birthday my guru, friend, father figure. And I can go on." Dhanush and Aishwaryaa announced their separation on January 17, after 18 years of marriage.

308.title: Warne will be missed, have fond memories of playing with him: Yuvraj
308.article_body: Mourning the demise of Shane Warne, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "I have fond memories of playing with Warne. You will be missed. He was the king of spin and a legend of the game." "It is a sad day for world cricket," added Yuvraj in his tweet. "RIP legend," read a tweet from West Indies all-rounder Chris Gayle.

309.title: 3 women under trial for human trafficking attempt suicide in UP
309.article_body: Three women facing a human trafficking case allegedly attempted suicide outside a policeman's office in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district on Friday. As per a note written by the women, they were facing social boycott and were shunned by their families after getting arrested in the case. They were rushed to a hospital and discharged later, police said.

310.title: Sushil Kumar to give wrestling, fitness coaching to fellow Tihar inmates
310.article_body: Wrestler Sushil Kumar, currently lodged in Tihar Jail in the Chhatrasal Stadium murder case, will soon be giving coaching classes on wrestling and physical fitness to his fellow inmates, prison authorities said. We have decided to restore the routine activities in prisons due to a decrease in COVID cases, an official said. Kumar was arrested on May 23 last year.

311.title: Completely crushed: Shibani Dandekar pens note after Shane Warne's demise
311.article_body: Former Indian Premier League host Shibani Dandekar took to her Instagram Stories to pen a note on former Australian cricketer Shane Warne following his demise. Sharing an old picture with Warne, Shibani wrote, "Completely crushed!" "Warney you were more than just a cricket legend! Your energy was infectious. Will always remember how warm, kind and crazy you were," she added.

312.title: Warne's display in 2005 Ashes made me want to be a cricketer: Root
312.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne who passed away aged 52, Joe Root said Warne's "phenomenal" performances in the 2005 Ashes in England made him want to become a cricketer, and play at the highest level. Warne was the top wicket-taker picking 40 wickets with two 10-wicket hauls and three five-wicket hauls. Andrew Flintoff was the second highest wicket-taker with 24 wickets.

313.title: Ukraine to join NATO cyber defence centre as 'contributing participant'
313.article_body: Ukraine will be joining the NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence (CCDCOE) as a "contributing participant". The CCDCOE said it would benefit from Ukraine's "valuable experience from previous cyberattacks". CCDCOE Director Colonel Jaak Tarien said Ukraine could bring "valuable first-hand knowledge of "several adversaries" within the cyber domain to be used for research and training.

314.title: Indian student's birthday celebrated at Romanian camp after escaping Ukraine
314.article_body: Indian student Kartik's birthday was celebrated at a camp on Romanian border on Friday. Kartik was among the Indian students and nationals who escaped Ukraine amid war with Russia. Indian government has been evacuating its citizens from the countries bordering Ukraine including Romania, Poland, Slovakia, and Hungary under Operation Ganga.

315.title: Feels good to work round the clock: Saiyami Kher on her busy schedule
315.article_body: Actress Saiyami Kher, known for films like 'Mirzya' and 'Choked', opened up about her busy schedule. "It feels good to be working around the clock," said Saiyami, who is currently shooting for 'Ghoomer' and 'Faadu'. "I know how tough the waiting game has been, so now when I have long hours of work, I'm...very grateful and very happy," she added.

316.title: Grubhub ends driverless robots delivery deal with Russia's Yandex
316.article_body: US delivery firm Grubhub has decided to end its partnership with Russian tech firm Yandex for driverless robots that deliver food to college students in the US. "We're working with our campus partners on alternate service options as we shift away from Yandex over time," Grubhub said. The two firms had agreed on a multi-year partnership in July.

317.title: Doing everything we can to evacuate foreign students from Sumy: Ukraine
317.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said, "We're doing everything we can to evacuate hundreds of foreign students from the Sumy city." "Sumy is now on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe due to indiscriminate Russian shelling. Ukraine is doing its best to save and secure people," it added. India has expressed "deep concern" over the security of its students stranded in Sumy.

318.title: UK opens 1st 'smart' prison with no window bars; inmates to be called 'residents'
318.article_body: The UK has opened the first "smart" prison designed with latest technology and with no bars on windows, to drive down crime and reduce reoffending. Her Majesty's Prison (HMP) Five Wells' cells will be called "rooms" and inmates "residents". The 1,700-capacity prison has been designed with education, training and jobs for prisoners on release as its main purposes, government said.

319.title: US Supreme Court reinstates Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence
319.article_body: The US Supreme Court on Friday reinstated the death sentence for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev for his role in the 2013 attack. In 2015, Tsarnaev was convicted of all 30 charges against him. Notably, Tsarnaev does not face imminent execution due to a moratorium imposed by President Joe Biden's administration on the death penalty in federal cases.

320.title: Putin's war has always been a war against his own people: Branson
320.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson while expressing his thoughts on the Russian-Ukrainian war said Russian President Vladimir Putin's war has "always also been a war against his own people". He said Putin has created "a system of control, intimidation, oppression, and disinformation". He added Russians had their dignity "stripped away slowly but continuously" as Russia "slipped into totalitarianism".

321.title: Warne wasn't a big boozer; I sent him wine, 10 years later it's still there: Manager
321.article_body: Talking about late Australian leg-spinner Shane Warne, his manager James Erskine said, "Everyone thinks he was a big boozer but he wasn't a big boozer at all." Erskine added, "I sent him a crate of wine...10 years later it's still there. He doesn't drink...never took drugs. He hated drugs so nothing untoward." Warne passed away of a suspected heart attack.

322.title: Priorities fluctuated: Camila Cabello on break up with Shawn Mendes
322.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello, speaking about her break up with singer Shawn Mendes, said that her priorities have fluctuated and her focus has changed throughout her life. "We both started so young...We're...learning how to be healthy adults," she added. Camila further said that things change and take unexpected turns. They dated for two years before announcing their break up in November.

323.title: Indian chef wins ₹1 crore lottery in UAE, 24 years after first win
323.article_body: An Indian man working as a chef in UAE won a lottery of 500,000 Dirham (around ₹1 crore). Saidali Kannan won the Big Ticket draw for the second time, after winning a cash prize 24 years ago. "I've been sharing tickets almost every month with Saidali for the last 20 years. I believe he's very lucky," Kannan's friend said.

324.title: China announces $230 billion defence budget, 3 times that of India's
324.article_body: China has reserved $229.47 billion in the national budget this year to enhance military training and combat readiness for the People's Liberation Army. This is over three times that of India's ₹5.25 lakh crore ($70 billion) defence spending announced for 2022. China's defence budget has been increased by 7.1% as compared to last year.

325.title: Kapil Sharma in talks with 'Comedy Circus' producer for a film: Reports
325.article_body: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma is in advanced talks with 'Comedy Circus Ke Ajoobe' producer Vipul D Shah for a comedy film, as per reports. Vipul is also co-producing Akshay Kumar, Pankaj Tripathi and Yami Gautam starrer 'OMG 2' with Ashwin Varde. Kapil will also be seen in Nandita Das' yet-untitled project, where he'll play the role of a food delivery rider.

326.title: Faridabad man held for plotting to shoot rival's family in court for revenge
326.article_body: Faridabad police arrested a man for allegedly plotting to shoot the family of an accused who had attacked his cousin in December 2021. The accused, identified as Aman, was arrested when he came to the district court to attack the family of Pradeep, who was one among the three accused who had attacked his cousin last year, the police said.

327.title: A magician on field: Preity Zinta mourns Shane Warne's demise
327.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta mourned the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who passed away on Friday at the age of 52. "So sad to hear that Shane Warne is no more. He was a magician on...field and such a charismatic and flamboyant personality off the field," Preity wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture with the late cricketer.

328.title: Russia, Belarus boxers barred from international boxing meets
328.article_body: In view of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the International Boxing Association (IBA) has decided to bar Russian and Belarusian boxing contingents in international competitions. The decision has been taken on the lines of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) recommendations of cancelling sporting ties with them. The IBA also cancelled all upcoming boxing events scheduled in Russia and Belarus.

329.title: English county club Hampshire pay tribute to their former captain Shane Warne
329.article_body: Hampshire County Cricket Club paid tribute to their former captain Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52. The club chairman Rod Bransgrove called him "an inspirational leader and brilliant tactician". "Off the field, he was competitive, fun, naughty and lovable in equal measure," said Bransgrove. The English county club  tweeted an old photograph of Warne in Hampshire CCC colours.

330.title: IMD predicts strong winds in Delhi today
330.article_body: Delhi is likely to witness strong surface winds, up to 40 kmph, on Saturday, the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. The department predicts the maximum temperature to be 26°C while the minimum temperature is likely to be 14°C. The minimum temperature over the next six days is set to be around 14°C and 16°C.

331.title: CBI lackadaisical, SEBI too kind: Court as it rejects Ramkrishna's pre-arrest bail
331.article_body: Rejecting ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail in the co-location case, a Delhi court called CBI's conduct "lackadaisical". It said, "The conduct of...CBI is most lackadaisical...no action seems to have been taken against the main beneficiaries of the...co-location scam...for almost four full years...Even SEBI, despite being the...markets watchdog, has been too kind and gentle."

332.title: Lyricist Vivek clarifies quitting 'Maaran' over creative differences
332.article_body: Ahead of the release of Dhanush-starrer 'Maaran', lyricist Vivek has clarified that he had walked out of the film. "Due to creative differences I chose to move out of Maaran as a dialogue and screenplay writer," Vivek wrote on Twitter after people praised him for the dialogues of the film. Directed by Karthick Naren, 'Maaran' also stars Malavika Mohanan.

333.title: Funded singles ourselves: Salim Merchant on filming music videos amid COVID-19
333.article_body: Singer-composer Salim Merchant opened up about filming music videos amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. "During the lockdown, we didn't know when we would perform next and where our revenue stream would come from," he said, adding, "Budget was a worry, as we funded the singles ourselves." Salim added the pandemic gave him time to complete the tracks that were lying unfinished.

334.title: Snapchat turns off public heatmap as safety precaution in Ukraine
334.article_body: Snapchat is temporarily turning off its 'heatmap' feature for Ukraine as a safety precaution amid the ongoing war between Ukraine and Russia. The app will no longer show how many Snaps are being taken in particular locations. "We will continue to offer curated Stories comprised of Snaps submitted in Ukraine," Snapchat said.

335.title: Want to contest 2024 Lok Sabha polls from Moradabad: Robert Vadra
335.article_body: Husband of Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi, Robert Vadra, said in an interview that he wants to contest the 2024 Lok Sabha election from his home town Moradabad. "As people have high hopes from me, I will see if I can participate in the 2024 general elections or not. Everyday I am in service of people," he added.

336.title: Ankit Gujjar used phones inside Tihar for money transfer requests: CBI
336.article_body: Gangster Ankit Gujjar, who was allegedly murdered inside Tihar Jail in August 2021, was unauthorisedly using a mobile number to make requests for money transfers, CBI said. He used to contact his family and friends to make requests for transfer of payments to various persons, including jail officials, CBI added. The number was used in 10 handsets, CBI stated.

337.title: Heavy snowfall in Uttarakhand's Chamoli disrupts movement
337.article_body: With heavy snowfall in the high altitude regions of Uttarakhand, the road connecting the Niti-Mana valleys in Chamoli largely remained blocked and caused problems for commuters on Saturday. The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) is clearing the path for the villagers and soldiers. "Due to changing weather trends, the BRO is caught in multiple clearance activities," said the BRO station commander.

338.title: Operation Ganga will be a failure if something happens to us: Students stuck in Ukraine
338.article_body: In a video, India students stuck in Ukraine said, "We are afraid, we have awaited a lot and we cannot wait anymore. We are risking our life. We are moving towards the border." "If anything happens to us...then Operation Ganga will be biggest failure," they added. "This is our last request and last video," they further said.

339.title: Not in race with everyone else: Anubhav Sinha on making OTT series
339.article_body: Director Anubhav Sinha opened up on creating an OTT series, saying, "I have a lot of pressure from my team to come up with a series, but I'm not in...race to do what everyone else is doing." The filmmaker noted that cinemas and OTT can co-exist, adding, "Films that are made for cinematic experience will surely hit the theatre first."

340.title: PM Modi to unveil 9.5-ft-tall Shivaji Maharaj's statue in Pune tomorrow
340.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Pune tomorrow (Sunday) and will unveil the 9.5-foot-tall statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at the PMC headquarters. During the visit, the PM will also inaugurate the two priority stretches of the Pune Metro rail project between Vanaz-Garware College and Pimpri Chinchwad-Swargate. PM Modi will also address the public at MIT College ground at Kothrud.

341.title: Grandmother refused to leave Ukraine house, wants to fight: Gehraiyaan intimacy director
341.article_body: Mumbai-based Ukrainian filmmaker Dar Gai, who was 'Gehraiyaan' intimacy director, spoke to ETimes about her family in Ukraine. "My parents...went to our village, which is...45 minutes away from Kyiv. My grandmother, who's 78, refused to leave...[saying], 'Who will fight here? I want to fight'," Dar stated. "It has been...hard, but...what gives me hope is the human spirit," she added.

342.title: ₹1,298.38 cr collected as green tax in 6 yrs from vehicles entering Delhi
342.article_body: Delhi municipal bodies collected ₹1,298.38 crore as Environmental Compensation Cess (ECC), also called green tax, from commercial vehicles entering the city from October 2015 to December 2021, as per government data. Of the total ECC fund, ₹281.51 crore has been utilised in five projects and ₹1,016 crore remains unspent. ECC fund was created to check air pollution levels in Delhi.

343.title: Stole socks from Batman set, was told 'How many socks do you need': Robert
343.article_body: Actor Robert Pattinson has revealed that he stole socks from the sets of 'The Batman', adding it was impossible to take anything home. "I kept getting told by Warner Brothers, like, 'You know, it's fine to have a few, but you take them every day. How many socks do you need? Because we've been shooting for a year'," Robert said.

344.title: Islamic State claims Pakistan bombing that killed 63 at mosque
344.article_body: The Islamic State said a lone Afghan suicide bomber had carried out the attack at a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday, killing at least 63 people and injuring nearly 200 others. Pakistan's Information Minister Fawad Chaudhry said that three investigation teams have been established to study forensic evidence and closed-circuit TV footage to track down masterminds of the attack.

345.title: 5 members of family die as car falls into 200-ft-deep gorge in J&K, 1 injured
345.article_body: Five members of a family died and one person sustained injuries in a road accident that took place in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Saturday. Samba SHO said the family was travelling to Anantnag from Punjab's Amritsar when the car's driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle. The car fell into a gorge, which was around 200-feet deep, he added.

346.title: Kiara dances with sister Ishita at her pre-wedding festivities, shares video
346.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share a video of her dancing with her sister Ishita Advani at one of her pre-wedding festivities. In the video, Kiara and Ishita can be seen dancing to The Sky Is Pink's song 'For Aisha'. Earlier, Kiara had shared pictures from Ishita's bachelorette party on her Instagram Stories.

347.title: Efforts on to bring Naveen's mortal remains from Ukraine: K'taka CM Bommai
347.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said the government is making all efforts to bring the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar from Ukraine soon. Bommai said he will visit Naveen's residence in Haveri to console his family. The government has decided to provide compensation to his family as well. Naveen who studied MBBS in Ukraine died in shelling on Tuesday.
