348.title: 1 dead, 11 hurt as bus carrying CISF jawans falls into gorge in UP
348.article_body: One CISF jawan died and 11 others were injured after a bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in Uttar Pradesh's Markundi valley, police said on Saturday. The police added that the jawans had been travelling on election duty. "The driver lost control...and [bus] fell into a gorge after breaking the road railing," a police official said.

349.title: Bullock cart race cancelled in Punjab after authorities intervene
349.article_body: A bullock cart race was cancelled in a village in Punjab's Fatehgarh Sahib after the intervention of the district administration on Friday. A local animal welfare officer, Anil Kataria, alerted the administration and asked for its cancellation, saying that such races are banned by the Supreme Court. Later, the organisers tried to shift the tournament venue.

350.title: Our buses ready to evacuate Indian students, others from Ukraine: Russia to UN
350.article_body: Russia's Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia has informed that Russian buses are ready at crossing points to go to the eastern Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv and Sumy to evacuate Indian students and other foreign nationals. "In the Belgorod region of Russia, 130 comfortable buses have been waiting (and standing ready) since 6:00 am today," Nebenzia stated.

351.title: I'm below average, people won't remember me 50yrs from now: Bhansali
351.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali in an interview has called himself "nothing special" and "a very below average human being". "Something is guiding me...protecting me and...making it possible for me to [make] 'Bajirao Mastani' and 'Padmaavat' and 'Ramleela'," he added. Bhansali further said that he doesn't think people will remember him 50 years from now but they will remember his work.

352.title: 66,224 have returned from abroad to fight in Ukraine: Defence Min
352.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Saturday said that 66,224 Ukrainian men had returned from abroad "at this moment to defend their Country" from the invading Russian forces. "These are 12 more combat and motivated brigades! Ukrainians, we are invincible," he added. Separately, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has urged foreigners to join its fight against Russian forces.

353.title: Virat Kohli gets guard of honour from teammates, pic goes viral
353.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli, who is playing his 100th Test, was given a guard of honour by his teammates when India were coming out to field against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Mohali. BCCI shared a picture on Twitter, writing, "Beauty of the sport." Kohli entered the field with his one hand raised.

354.title: Govt likes to indulge in PR: Tharoor on Minister's speeches over evacuation
354.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor appreciated the Central government for evacuating Indians from war-hit Ukraine but criticised it for indulging in 'PR exercise'. "This government has a problem... it likes to indulge PR exercise," said Tharoor. "A minister went to Romania and said that we are all doing this for you...why are you coming here and giving a speech?" he added.

355.title: Mother Dairy to hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR from tomorrow
355.article_body: Mother Dairy on Saturday announced that it will hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre for all milk variants in Delhi-NCR from March 6. The company cited a rise in fuel costs, costs of packing material and procurement prices as the reason for it. Apart from this, Amul and Parag Milk Foods had also increased milk prices recently.

356.title: Sushmita shares hoarding saying 'How can you adopt without marriage?'
356.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen on Friday shared a picture of a hoarding in Mumbai which says, "Bina shaadi ke child adopt kaise kar sakti ho (How can you adopt a child without marriage)?" She captioned her post, "Heard this one too many times before I decided to stop listening. Single mother by choice." Sushmita adopted her daughters in 2000 and 2010.

357.title: Over 11,000 Indian citizens evacuated from Ukraine so far: MoS V Muraleedharan
357.article_body: Over 11,000 Indian nationals have been evacuated from Ukraine amid war, Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan confirmed in a tweet on Saturday. "Operation Ganga is in full swing...Happy to have received a group of 170 Indians at New Delhi airport, evacuated through AirAsia India. Thank our Missions, foreign governments, and volunteers for their constant support," he added.

358.title: Raut alleges phone tapping of Opposition leaders ahead of poll results
358.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut accused BJP of tapping of phones of "several Opposition leaders in the states where elections are being held" and said that they got huge information about phone tapping of Goa leaders. He also mentioned ex-Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla against whom a case was registered recently for alleged involvement in phone tapping of Nana Patole.

359.title: Shane Warne's demise feels like a personal loss: Rahul Dravid
359.article_body: Condoling the demise of Shane Warne, Rahul Dravid said, "Even if you didn't meet him often, Warne could make it feel like this was personal and it really feels like a personal loss." "Playing with Warne as a colleague will...be one of the highlights of my cricketing career," added Dravid. Warne and Dravid played together for Rajasthan Royals.

360.title: Every player has set plans for Pakistan who have come prepared: Mithali
360.article_body: Discussing India Women's opening match of the 2022 Women's World Cup against Pakistan, ODI captain Mithali Raj said every player in the team has set plans for taking on Pakistan, who have come prepared. "We are equally prepared to put our best foot forward and we want to set a momentum going into the tournament," added Mithali.

361.title: Copyright case against Ed Sheeran's 2017 song Shape Of You begins
361.article_body: The case against singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran's 2017 song 'Shape of You' began in London High Court on Friday. The case alleges that the song infringes the copyright of Sami Switch's 2015 song 'Oh Why' as "particular lines and phrases" are similar to it. Sami claimed he sent his song to Ed's inner circle in a bid to work with him.

362.title: 4th Corporator quits BJP ahead of Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal polls
362.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporator Maya Barne on Friday resigned from the civic body and the membership of the BJP, making her the fourth Corporator to quit the party in the last two weeks. The resignations have come ahead of civic body polls. "Massive corruption has taken place during the BJP regime...I was also fed up with...dictatorial attitude of some...leaders," she said.

363.title: Ukraine shares video of Russian military helicopter downed by its missile
363.article_body: Ukraine Defence Ministry has shared a video of Russian military helicopter being downed by its anti-aircraft system. "This is how the Russian occupiers are dying. This time in a helicopter! Glory to Ukraine and its defenders! Together to victory," the ministry tweeted with the video. This comes as Russia declared ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors for civilians.

364.title: Passengers push train coaches away from burning engine in UP, video viral
364.article_body: After a fire broke out in the engine and two coaches of the Saharanpur-Delhi passenger train on Saturday, passengers were seen pushing the rest of the compartments away from the burning engine and coaches. A video of the passengers separating the coaches to prevent the spread of the fire has also gone viral online. The incident took place in Meerut.

365.title: Meat of endangered sharks found in pet food: DNA study
365.article_body: Scientists have discovered the DNA of endangered sharks in packaged food being fed to cats and dogs. Based on the DNA study, researchers have found that several brands of pet food contained the meat of endangered species of sharks. These brands, however, only listed 'ocean fish' as an ingredient, making the consumers unknowingly contribute to the overfishing of shark populations.

366.title: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia inaugurates swimming pools in 2 govt schools
366.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday inaugurated new swimming pools in two Delhi government schools in Mayur Vihar and Mandawali. "CM Arvind Kejriwal is committed to providing world-class facilities to the students," he tweeted. The pool in the school in Mayur Vihar will be fully functional and open for all children from nearby schools from April 1, Sisodia added.

367.title: Man takes gold loan to pay earlier loan, cheats firm of ₹10 lakh in Pune
367.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly cheating a Pune-based private financial service provider company of ₹10.20 lakh. The accused had taken a loan from the company and promised to mortgage the gold against that. However, he used the loan amount to pay off another gold loan he'd, leaving the current company short of ₹10,20,658 and the gold, said police.

368.title: Pic shows couple kissing through fence as wife waits to board evacuation train in Ukraine
368.article_body: A picture shows a husband kissing his wife goodbye through a train platform fence as she waits to board an evacuation train with their 11-month-old son in Ukraine. They had escaped heavy overnight fighting in Bucha and Irpin. Male citizens of Ukraine aged 18 to 60 are prohibited from leaving the country amid war with Russia.

369.title: Extraordinary times: Musk calls for boost in oil & gas output amid Russia-Ukraine war
369.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Saturday called for an increase in oil and gas output as "extraordinary times demand extraordinary measures." Musk wrote, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately…Obviously, this would negatively affect Tesla, but sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil and gas exports."

370.title: Set worth ₹1.75 cr erected in Mumbai for Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Reports
370.article_body: A set worth ₹1.75 crore has been erected in Mumbai's Filmcity for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's upcoming web show 'Heeramandi', as per reports. The historical drama, which will feature Sonakshi Sinha and Aditi Rao Hydari, will reportedly go on floors by the end of this month. The forthcoming project will also star Huma Qureshi and Manisha Koirala, as per reports.

371.title: Haas F1 team terminates Russian driver Nikita Mazepin's contract
371.article_body: Haas F1 team has terminated Russian driver Nikita Mazepin's contract. It has also terminated the title partnership of Uralkali, a Russian potash fertilizer producer and exporter company. "As with the rest of the Formula 1 community, the team is shocked and saddened by the invasion of Ukraine and wishes for a swift and peaceful end to the conflict," it tweeted.

372.title: Ukrainian married to Kashmiri man urges PM Modi to help her country
372.article_body: A Ukrainian woman named Oliza has urged PM Modi and the Indian government to help her conflict-torn country in every possible way. Oliza is married to a Kashmiri man and lives in Pulwama. "Today, our country is fighting for democracy and peace. They have independence in their heart and won't let Russia come and stay in our homes," she said.

373.title: Ericsson, CEO sued in US over possible dealings with ISIS in Iraq
373.article_body: Swedish firm Ericsson, its CEO and CFO have been sued in the US for misleading investors about the company's dealings in Iraq, a filing revealed. The firm revealed last month that an internal investigation showed its possible involvement in the payments to ISIS. Ericsson has called the allegations against it and its officers false and misleading.

374.title: B'luru police arrests 2 for providing fake SIM cards to fraudster
374.article_body: Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty on Friday said that two people have been arrested for allegedly providing fake SIM cards to a fraudster. He also warned people against providing multiple copies of documents while purchasing SIM cards. Furthermore, he also urged people to be careful if a sales executive asked for their fingerprint more than once.

375.title: We took one day at a time: Urvashi Rautela on shooting in Ukraine
375.article_body: Urvashi Rautela, who was shooting for a film in Ukraine's Kyiv and Odesa, flew back to India two days before Russia launched a military operation in Ukraine. "While we were shooting, there was a lot of tension between both the countries...But we took one day at a time," she said. Urvashi further said the situation in Ukraine is "really terrifying".

376.title: CRED loss widens to ₹524 crore in FY21, revenue jumps to ₹95 crore
376.article_body: Entrepreneur Kunal Shah-founded fintech startup CRED's losses widened by 45% year-on-year to ₹524 crore for the financial year ending March 31, 2021, compared to ₹360 crore a year ago. Its revenue jumped from ₹18.16 crore in FY20 to ₹95.53 crore in FY21. During this period, CRED spent ₹222 crore on marketing, up 289% from ₹57 crore in the previous year.

377.title: South Korean wildfire destroys 159 homes, forces 6,200 to flee
377.article_body: Thousands of South Korean firefighters and troops are battling a large wildfire that has spread across more than 6,000 hectares (almost 15,000 acres). The fire, which began on Friday morning, has reportedly destroyed at least 159 homes and 46 other buildings and prompted the evacuation of over 6,200 people. There were no immediate reports of injuries or deaths.

378.title: Over 1,200 hospitalised after eating food at wedding of Cong leader's son in Guj
378.article_body: Over 1,200 people fell ill and had to be hospitalised after they consumed food at the wedding function of a local Congress leader's son in a village in Gujarat's Mehsana district, police said. "People started vomiting and complained of diarrhoea...They were rushed to different hospitals," Mehsana SP said. Samples of the food have been collected for further examination, he added.

379.title: Warne would talk about cricket even at parties: Mohammad Kaif
379.article_body: Talking about Australian spin legend Shane Warne, Mohammad Kaif said Warne would take players like Ravindra Jadeja to parties while leading Rajasthan Royals, but would talk about cricket even during parties. "I am numb, I don't have words to express my feelings. It is very, very shocking," added Kaif. Warne passed away at the age of 52.

380.title: Pic shows Ukrainian soldier carrying baby to safety after bridge gets destroyed
380.article_body: An image shows a baby being cradled by a soldier near a scene of destruction amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The baby has been pictured near a blown up bridge with rubble, twisted metal and cables lying in water and mud in the town of Irpin, near Kyiv, after shelling. Apartment blocks and vehicles were also blown up in Irpin.

381.title: Musk mocks Russia's 'let US fly to space on broomsticks' remark with SpaceX launch
381.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk mocked Russia after the country said it would stop providing rocket engines to the US in retaliation to sanctions. "Let them fly on something else, their broomsticks, I don't know what," Russian space agency's chief Dmitry Rogozin had said. Commenting on a video of SpaceX launching 47 Starlink satellites into orbit, Musk wrote, "American broomstick."

382.title: Assam police arrest 5 with links to outfit affiliated with Al-Qaeda
382.article_body: Assam's Barpeta Police have arrested five persons for their alleged links to a jihadi outfit based in Bangladesh which is affiliated with Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent, a press release said on Saturday.  The accused had the "view to develop Barpeta as a base for jihadi work", it added. Incriminating documents and devices were also seized, it further said.

383.title: I'm in Kyiv, working: Zelenskyy shares video after Russia claims he fled to Poland
383.article_body: Reacting to Russian media reports that claimed he had fled the country, Ukrainian President  Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday posted a video on Instagram from his office in Kyiv. Sharing the video, Zelenskyy wrote, "I am in Kyiv. I am working here. No one has escaped anywhere." Russian politician Vyacheslav Volodin had claimed that Zelenskyy had escaped to Poland.

384.title: Parts of Pune's Karve, Paud Road to be closed amid PM Modi's visit
384.article_body: Portions of Pune's Karve Road and Paud Road will be closed between 10 am to 2 pm amid PM Narendra Modi's visit on Sunday, orders issued by DCP (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame stated. Vehicles coming from Kothrud via Karve Road will be diverted at Tilak chowk, while those coming towards Deccan area from Shivtirth Nagar will be diverted at Mayur Colony.

385.title: Engine, 2 coaches of UP-Delhi passenger train gutted in fire; no injuries reported
385.article_body: The engine and two coaches of a passenger train en route to Delhi from Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur were gutted in fire on Saturday morning. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident, which took place at Daurala railway station near Meerut. A video footage purportedly showed passengers pushing the train to separate it from the coaches affected by fire.

386.title: CBI court refuses anticipatory bail to ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna
386.article_body: A special CBI court has dismissed the anticipatory bail of former NSE chief executive Chitra Ramkrishna in connection with the NSE co-location case. Accused of sharing information with a 'Himalayan yogi', the court said that no grounds were made out to grant anticipatory bail to Ramkrishna. It is reported that the CBI argued against granting protection to her.

387.title: India declare at 574/8 against Sri Lanka with Ravindra Jadeja not out on 175
387.article_body: India declared their first innings in the first Test at 574/8 with all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja batting at 175*(228). Jadeja and Mohammad Shami shared an unbeaten ninth-wicket partnership of 103 runs. Rishabh Pant, Ravichandran Ashwin and Hanuma Vihari scored fifties for India, while Virat Kohli, playing in his 100th Test, registered 45(76) in the first innings.

388.title: BJP seeks votes on the basis of lies: Rahul Gandhi
388.article_body: Addressing a rally in Varanasi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday attacked PM Modi and said he claims to protect Hinduism but he protects lies. "I respect you all enough to never lie on your faces. They (Bharatiya Janata Party) do not seek votes on the name of the Hindu religion, but on the basis of lies," he said.

389.title: Local BJP leader held in Chhattisgarh for assaulting journalist in Durg
389.article_body: Police arrested a local BJP leader in Chhattisgarh for allegedly assaulting a journalist, identified as Dhirendra Giri Goswami, in the Durg district. The alleged assault took place in a colony under the Amleshwar Police Station area on Thursday night, police said. "Some unidentified person hit Goswami on his head with a sharp-edged weapon and injured him," the FIR states.

390.title: Man held for blackmailing woman with nude photos, videos in B'luru
390.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly blackmailing women with their nude selfie videos and photos in Bengaluru. As per police, the accused would give missed calls to women and trap them into a relationship by talking sweet once they called him back. He would then film their intimate moments and blackmail them for money.

391.title: Crime reporter killed in Mexico; 7th to be murdered this year
391.article_body: A crime reporter was shot and killed in Mexico's Zacatecas on Friday, officials said. Juan Muniz, who also worked as a taxi driver, was reportedly shot in the head while driving passengers. Zacatecas' Governor, David Monreal, condemned the killing and asked police to "find those guilty as quickly as possible". So far, seven media workers have been killed in Mexico.

392.title: 11 Pune hospitals owe ₹12 lakh to 25 COVID-19 patients; PMC issues notices
392.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has issued show-cause notices to at least 11 private hospitals in the city for not refunding the excess amount charged to COVID-19 patients. According to officials, at least 25 patients have to be reimbursed over ₹12 lakh. These bills were audited by the civic body for patients admitted between May and November last year.

393.title: Australia defeat defending champions England in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener
393.article_body: Australia defeated defending champions England by 12 runs in their first match at 2022 Women's World Cup. Australia opener Rachael Haynes scored her career-best 130 runs off 131 deliveries to help her team post a total of 310/3. Alana King picked up three wickets, while Tahila McGrath took two wickets as England were restricted to 298/8 in their 50 overs.

394.title: PayPal shuts services in Russia, condemns it for violent aggression
394.article_body: US-based payments company PayPal has announced that it has shut down its services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. PayPal CEO said the firm "stands with the international community in condemning Russia's violent military aggression in Ukraine". PayPal had stopped accepting new users in the country on Wednesday. It will support withdrawals "for a period of time".

395.title: Will challenge EC in SC over fund payment before Manipur polls: Cong
395.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accused Election Commission of helping BJP in the Manipur polls and said that he will file a petition in the Supreme Court challenging the EC's decision. He opposed EC's decision of not considering BJP-led Manipur government's payment of funds to the banned militant groups before the state polls as violation of Model Code of Conduct.

396.title: Mumbai doctor trying to recharge OTT platform loses ₹1.80 lakh to cyber fraudster
396.article_body: A doctor from Mumbai lost ₹1.80 lakh to a cyber fraudster while trying to recharge an OTT platform. Police said the victim received a reminder email from an unknown email address when the OTT platform's recharge period expired. She clicked on a link and was asked to fill in her bank details and OTP, following which she lost the money.

397.title: Shane Warne condemned Russia's attack on Ukraine as 'unjustified' days before demise
397.article_body: Days before his demise, former Australian cricketer Shane Warne criticised Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it an "unprovoked and unjustified" attack in a tweet. "The pictures are horrific and I can't believe more is not being done to stop this," he wrote. Tagging Ukrainian football manager Andriy Shevchenko, Warne said, "Sending lots of love to my Ukrainian mate...and his family."

398.title: If you were friends with Warne, they didn't sledge: Kumble on Australia's 'untold secret'
398.article_body: Recalling an "untold secret" of Australian team involving Shane Warne, Anil Kumble said, "When you went out to bat...and if you were friends with Warne, you didn't get any banter from the Australians." Kumble added, "So when I went to bat...Aussies didn't need to do any banter to unsettle me. That was Warnie...that was how he looked after his friends."

399.title: Mumbai Monorail to be linked with Colaba-Seepz Metro-3 line at Mahalaxmi
399.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is planning to connect the Mumbai Monorail corridor with the Colaba-Seepz underground Metro-3 line. According to reports, the Chembur-Jacob Circle Monorail corridor will be extended by about 500 metres to link it with Mahalaxmi Metro Station. The extension is expected to improve the connectivity in Mahalaxmi, Parel and Wadala areas.

400.title: Govt proposes 10% tree cover for residential, commercial construction sites
400.article_body: The Centre has proposed that at least one tree be planted in every 80 square metres of land in order to ensure residential and commercial construction sites have at least 10% of their area under green cover. The draft rules will apply to old as well as new buildings having a built-up area of or greater than 5,000 square metres.
